target: 我以相对缓慢的步伐走近门口，向爸爸打了个招呼。“我出去一会儿，晚饭在冰箱里。”没有回应。意料之中的事。他通常都会听见我的，不过他应该没事。我慢慢地关上身后的门，随着门完全关上，我又松了一口气。几乎忘记了，我把手放在冷冰冰的金属扫描仪上，这个扫描仪锁定了门。如果这间公寓有任何东西的话，那就是先进的技术，但再说一遍，大多数地方都有值得注意的技术——自从有人使用任何其他不同的技术以来，已经过去了很长时间。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 寒冷的雨夜伴随着我久违的漫步——探索帕特里克斯城对于那些通过逃跑或纯粹的运气而免受基因突变的人来说是一种特权。城市的夜晚很美，充满了充满活力的恒星，这些恒星已经存在了几千年。遥远的天空一定很孤独。帕特里克斯是一个不错的地方，但感觉更像是一个笼子，而不是一个豪华的生活场所。公寓、房屋和任何其他能够容纳居住者的建筑物都填满了大楼，大多数建筑物高达数百层。感谢 Ignniat。这种矿物质安抚了技术和建筑，这是一种伟大的矿物质，延伸了我们的生活基础。公众对这种矿物质的了解有限，主要是因为它被严密地包裹起来。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 我摆脱了混乱的思绪，找到了我最喜欢的咖啡店；大多数人避开它，因为传言称该地区发现了疏漏，这是社会对受病毒感染的人的称呼。这从来没有真正困扰过我，我一生都很幸运，而且老板是个好人。谁会放弃免费咖啡来换取深夜的谈话和聊天呢？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进店里，一阵响亮的铃声驱散了我的不适，新煮咖啡的香气充斥着我的肺部。店主安东当然是柜台后面的那个人——除了后面的一些人之外，这个地方几乎空无一人。走到柜台前，我的双脚因长途跋涉而疲惫不堪，我昏昏欲睡地坐在一张凳子上，打了个呵欠。我发现安东带来了定期的感谢。“嘿，莉莉丝，晚上好吗？”他沙哑的声音在我大脑的分形中回荡。“大致如此，”我浅薄地回答，越来越疲倦。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 为了解决我的疲劳，我喝了几口放在我面前的咖啡。“自从那次目击事件以来，生意仍然低迷。？”我静静地说话，并没有试图吓跑安东部门剩下的顾客。他点点头，用抹布擦了擦玻璃杯— —从技术上讲，这个地方是酒吧，但我从来没有真正来喝酒。后面可以听到一些窃窃私语，但今晚我和安东之间的谈话大部分都很简短。我向他挥手告别，离开了商店；比以前多了一点精力。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 深夜在黑暗的街道上漫步通常不是最好的选择，但说实话，这比呆在那间闷热的公寓要好得多；大多数时候，你可以听到邻居做爱的声音，而不是听音乐。随着一声轻快的叹息，我将目光转向前方——我可能会前往阿尔的典当行；只是一个我发现有趣的垃圾的地方，作为消遣。当我听到身后传来脚步声时，我感到后悔莫及，也许我想得太多了，但除非他们想被抢劫或殴打，否则没有人会在这个地方逗留。它因黑手党和帮派活动而闻名......

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我悄悄地朝商店后面走去，在金属格栅后面可以听到低语和谈话声，需要用几次拉力才能把它撕开。爬进通风口是目前对我来说最安全、最安静的选择；通过攀爬，我可以听到穿着奇怪的男人之间的谈话。我注意到艾尔被锁在里面。他迟早会被抓住的。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔伯恩是个好人，但这看起来很严重。没必要为别人出头，尤其是当他们似乎刚刚与这座城市的每一个当局陷入麻烦时。然而，我仍然无法摆脱这种感觉。我放出一声无声的叹息，慢慢地从下面的格栅上移开，掉进了安静的房间。“嘘。阿尔。阿尔！”我低语着，对他的无反应大喊道。“莉莉丝？你在这里做什么？你必须离开，他会抓住你。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 没错，我默默地对自己说。试图用锁匙打开缠绕在他手臂上的链条时，声音接近了我们的位置，微弱的脚步声变得越来越响亮。“快！回到通风口，离开。不要回来。如果我们再见面，就不是在这个城市。”他急忙说道，他脸上闪现的恐慌丝毫没有帮助我的神经。听取他的建议。我无法让自己停留得更久。该死，阿尔。我在离开通风口后迅速跑过去；失去这样一位宝贵的朋友有点痛苦。他们要把他转移到另一个城市吗？我的头脑有点混乱，脑海中闪过许多事情，其中大多数都是愤怒和悲伤。我对外城和受感染的首都阿尔卡特拉斯（他们以监狱的名字命名）进行了多种研究，从我读到的内容来看，感觉这个名字非常合适。更不用说未变异者已经切断了任何剩余的连接土地与受感染土地之间的联系，这真是……悲惨。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家的路上很安静，但却很嘈杂。感染我大脑的想法如火如荼，多次闪现出对没有留下来帮忙的遗憾。我终于到家了，几乎被上面云层爆发的声音吓哭了，有时雷鸣般的轰鸣声足以吓坏任何人。爸爸已经昏倒在沙发上，正在重播一部老电影，可能是 10-12 年前的电影。我叹了口气，悄悄地爬回房间。躺在床上，我无法睁开眼睛很久。很快，睡意就笼罩了我。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 几天过去了，我甚至还没来得及意识到这一点。几天前，阿尔博恩被带走了— —我不知道他被带到了哪里，但我知道他被带到了什么地方。那些服装看起来很熟悉，但我第一次尝试时根本不可能弄清楚。叹了口气，我把手放在我面前的系统上，散发出红色和紫色的光芒— —我可以破解安全，这个地方并不遥远，我怀疑他们采取了措施... ...也许我不应该。当然，违背所有道德，我的手指在我不知情的情况下移动，拉起了多个屏幕；天哪，我很好。我在几个网站上很受欢迎，他们称我为“WRAITH”，但我认为这是一个很吸引人的名字。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 我把监控移到我的移动设备上，聚精会神地看着每一个人。什么都没有。就像他们从来没有在那里一样。这没有道理。即使可以远程访问，相机也具有严密的安全性。怎么......? ARGH。我愤怒地站在那里，准备消除我脑海中的一些想法— —我走了过来，穿上鞋子，拿走钥匙。“我很快就会回来，爸爸。”沉默。不管怎样，他通常不会回应，反正他可能正在忙着做比我更重要的事情。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 当我走出公寓时，突然一阵震动，我感到一阵寒颤从我的脊柱向下蔓延；很奇怪。无视这种感觉，我催促自己前往阿尔酒吧进行调查，但我的腿却朝安东的小酒吧移动——那里是一个相当平静的地方，我肯定需要和某人谈谈。还有谁比欠你人情的酒保更好呢？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 不规则地，安东的工作非常繁忙；那里充满了活动和我从未见过的新面孔——安东经常是唯一的工人，所以我知道他一定非常紧张。“嘿，酒吧老板，给我一杯咖啡。”我故意用低沉的语气来打扰他，看到他转身后松了一口气，我忍不住咯咯地笑。“天哪，莉莉丝，别这样对我......”他轻声说道，显然很累。“你看起来很忙......你需要帮手吗？看起来这里有很多人。”我气哼哼地说道，我不想帮这些醉汉，但我觉得让这个人独自在这里工作很糟糕。“你能吗？我会付你钱......”他用小狗一样的眼睛直视着我。高级战争战术......

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 当巨大的色拉基(Thraki)点燃一片特定的森林时，一阵火焰从萨萨林的嘴巴中喷出，然后在上面盘旋，观察了一会儿。奇怪的是，当他放慢速度时，身后传来的奇怪的尖叫声停止了。萨萨林忘记了他背上有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我自己的飞行与被一条巨大的粉红色龙突然拖走完全不同！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯耶尔显然不同意尼西的观点，他看起来不像正常人那么黑，他的爪子已经扎进了萨萨林的背部，以至于他让色拉基流血了，但萨萨林显然并不在意。尽管如此，萨萨林意识到他吓到了他的新朋友，并找到了一块空地降落。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: “我很抱歉，但我捡到了一个镜像。我必须处理它！”

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你也得拖着我们走吗？”特努克从萨萨林的背上爬下来，顺着尾巴滑下来，厉声说道。“我们把雷特维克抛在了后面！我们抛弃了我们这个高大、强壮、好斗的家伙！他怎么才能找到我们呢？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: “他会解决的......”尼西嘲笑道。“雷特维克很迟钝，但他不是傻瓜。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: 尼西眨了眨眼，转向特努克。“他当然会开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，显然不是。怪物只是发出嘶嘶声，试图直接飞向塔萨林。谢天谢地，尽管塔萨林的体型很大，但他足够灵活，能够避开障碍，但尼西却忍不住尖叫，因为她几乎失去了对塔萨林过于光滑鳞片的抓握力。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: 塔萨林发出嘶嘶声，然后绕圈子，越来越靠近他称之为家的山。黑暗的野兽紧随其后，但当一阵火焰从后面袭击它时，它有点惊慌失措。这个生物没有意识到它不再孤独了。当塔萨林减速时，它更加惊慌失措，然后用尾巴猛击野兽的头部，打乱了它的方向。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 这个生物咆哮着，发出嘶嘶声，向上飞去，向空中吐口水。一切突然变得黑暗，就好像怪物正在吸走天空本身的光线，取而代之的是一朵永夜的云。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 萨萨林再也看不见了，他试图撤退，但发现自己撞到了树线的顶部，然后撞上了一片空地。这个生物似乎确切地知道萨萨林掉落的位置，并带着乌云径直朝他走去。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: “凯尔！”特努克喊道，他从云层中滑出，开始盘旋，试图在下面的黑暗中发现尼西和塔萨林。“我们该怎么办？凯尔......?凯尔，你在哪里？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: 下面，尼西爬了起来。她非常肯定自己弄坏了什么东西，但她的奇怪、不自然的治愈能力已经发挥作用了。塔萨林的情况就不一样了，他蜷缩着躺在一棵树下，这棵树没有因为他的重量而倒塌。尼西尽力试图接近塔萨林，但她几乎看不到前方几米以外的地方。一切都漆黑一片，笼罩在邪恶的阴影中。阴影中，有东西在尖叫和吼叫。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 一条可怕的、带有棍棒的尾巴砸在尼西附近的地面上，把她撞倒。虽然她注意到尾巴在抽打，但并没有瞄准她。尼西所能看到和听到的小生物咆哮着，用爪子抓着它制造的阴影。某种东西在黑暗中瞬间移动，刺向怪物，迷惑了它。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: “求你了！”艾文女王恳求道，“不要把她送走！她还只是个孩子！”冰王从王座上低头看着他的妻子，他的皇家顾问就在他旁边。她生下了一个女孩。想到这个，他皱起了眉头。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 这个女孩看起来很像她的母亲；淡蓝色的眼睛和白色的头发上点缀着蓝色的发丝。冰王认为女儿会让他看起来很软弱。毕竟，到目前为止，他只有儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: “你唯一的选择就是杀死这个孩子或把它送到荒野。这是她对你的错误行为的惩罚，艾文。”他吐出她的名字，就像那是毒药一样。他总是这样做。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 冰封王国并不总是一个王国。它被分为两个部分，北方和南方。在北方，这是一个非魔法王国。在南方，这是一个充满奇幻力量展示的王国。由于北方的贪婪，两个王国陷入了无休止的战争，直到南方提出休战。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方绝望了，他们的王室将不惜一切代价阻止流血。他们提出让他们唯一的公主成为北方的女王，并生下一个儿子成为未来的国王。然后，南方将与北方联合起来，建立一个王国。北方接受了，艾文公主嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: “我恳求你，我的国王，为了我的孩子的安全，你可以对我做任何你想做的事情，锁我起来，放逐我，甚至杀了我。”伊尔文女王紧紧地抱着她的孩子恳求道。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王低头看着他的女王，眼中流露出厌恶。也许，只是也许，他会怜悯她。那个与他相伴了二十二年的女人，那个在他最低潮时总是照顾他的女人，那个生下了他儿子的女人。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: “很好。孩子可以住在宫殿里。”他开始说，得到了女王的叹息。“但是，”他补充道。“你将被处死。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和艾文女王本人都露出了惊恐的表情。她慢慢地低头看着地板。“是的，我的国王。”她鞠躬。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
target: 她翻到一张空白页上，并在上面写下日期。下面，她写道：“5/11/648 -12/13/648”。

source: “Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “回忆旧时光？”伊娃看着旧笔记本问道。卡莉点了点头。“你认为他们会让你出去过圣诞节吗？离圣诞节只有几天了。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡莉在灯笼上敲了两下。不，正如象牙所预测的那样。冰王从来不让卡莉出去，因为她在他眼中被视为“一个缺陷”。她生来就是哑巴，而且是家里唯一的女孩，因为家里都是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 象牙也以自己的特殊方式做到了这一点。当象牙宣布自己是非二元性别时，世界似乎也发生了变化。他们被分配的工作会让他们大部分时间独自一人，这是对他们与众不同的一种惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们还被迫成为公主的仆人。他们并不介意，因为他们也有朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “很快就要过生日了，是吗？”伊娃回忆起公主的生日就在几天后，问道。卡丽点了点头，淡蓝色的眼睛里闪烁着悲伤的光芒。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: “你想庆祝一下吗？”他们问道，回想起她上次的回答。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 不。卡莉退出了。伊娃知道这对她来说是一个艰难的话题。那天她被关在房间里，她的母亲被逐出家门。当事情发生时，伊娃还只是个婴儿，但他们记得仆人和镇民的愤怒。他们听说艾尔文女王是个好女王，但也奇怪地预测了将要发生的事情。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: “那么……你想做什么？”他们问。卡丽兴奋地抬头看着他们。她把一张纸递给了伊娃。然而，当他们低头看时......

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 意大利时间 4 点 30 分。科伦讨厌这么早就醒来。主要是因为他有责任叫醒公司里的其他人。他悄无声息地走出卧铺，穿上作战服，披上冲锋衣，从储物柜里收拾好自己的行李，小心地拿起一个特别的小盒子。他拿起步枪，把头盔挂在腰带上连接的小钩子上。它有所有的固定装置、呼吸器、护目镜、所有需要的东西。检查完弹药袋后，他悄无声息地走出营房，靴子下面的泥和冰发出嘎吱声。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从夹克口袋里拿出打火机，从另一个口袋里拿出香烟，点燃后吸了一口，然后轻轻打开门。上周，他不得不发挥创造力来唤醒他指挥的男男女女。他不再使用预设的闹钟，因为一半时间它根本不起作用，扬声器里传出的只有轻微的嘶嘶声。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: “叫醒他们”科伦转过身，看见中尉尼米克走了过来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 他还没来得及回答，门就打开了，哈里斯、克雷思和其他几个人匆匆走了出来，他们已经穿戴整齐。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，先生。现在应该已经在路上了，我们给了他们时间从混乱中获取口粮。”0500整， Exodus连队在汽车池集合。Shaw踏上一个盒子，开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: “我们将前往距伊安洛斯50英里外的FOB I-131。我们将支持对伊安洛斯正在进行的围困和随后的袭击，以消灭那里的叛乱分子。从那里我们将有一个立足点和山基”肖解释道。“与你的小队一起上马”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 连队散开了，加入了他们的小队，他们的中士让他们登上了其中一辆坦克。科伦把自己拉到车队更远处的一辆坦克上，与内米奇、克雷思和两名新兵会合。科伦记得他们几天前到达，但对他们了解不多。他坐在一边，把腿悬在一边，调整了他的背包和收音机，它们连接到他的耳机和喉咙麦克风。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: “嘿，科伦，哈里斯还有雪球吗？”当他们安顿下来时，内米奇问道。

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你是说他偷了他的鸡吗？”科伦记得他们从农场偷走他的那天早上。“是的，我很确定。”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦瞥了一眼其他坦克中的一辆，发现了哈里斯和他的小队。从他的背包后面，他可以辨认出一只小鸡的动作，它的头在四处移动，扫视着周围的环境。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: “是的，他还在”科伦回答道，坦克的炮塔舱门咔嗒一声打开，指挥官出现在视线中。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有坦克都在撤离”指挥官平静但清晰地对着耳机说道。一排坦克和 Stryker 的引擎轰鸣着启动，开始向前移动。克罗诺斯·科伦号在其断路器释放并向前移动时发生震动，进入阵型。坦克以楔形队形穿越伊塔尼亚平原。冬季风暴冻结了湿地和森林，但泥土却始终存在。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 大约一小时后，新兵之一科伦记起他的名字是奥森，于是站出来说道。“中尉，你从战争开始就一直在这里，对吗？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: “是的，烈火风暴行动，”科伦回答道。“我们以为这会在几周内结束，但......我们低估了他们。”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising. With our recent discovery of Ignniat, humanity has once skyrocketed past its peak; the greatest has yet to be achieved. This grace of newfound knowledge could only be described as divine intervention - we humanity will be able to grace the gods with our presence in their land in the clouds. Everyone within the company of Karascene has evaluated Ignniat and we sense a large potential within this mineral – worry not, Ignniat has not been evaluated to have any side effects or downsides of being mined, it has a higher chance to–
target: 人类的进步从来没有停止过，即使在艰难的时刻，我们也会再次成长和适应。城市依然繁荣，科技进步也在不断发展。我们最近发现了Ignniat，使人类的进步再次突破了峰值。最大的成就还没有实现。这份新发现的知识只能用神的干预来形容——我们人类将能够在云端登上神的宝座。Karascene团队中的每个人都对Ignniat进行了评估，我们感觉到这个矿物中蕴藏着巨大的潜力——不要担心，Ignniat还没有评估出任何开采的副作用或缺点，它有更高的机会——

source: A click. It had been reruns of this same stream, the day the world was ruined. Dad always found himself turning the channel off when I was unable to tear my eyes away. The somber face he gave me ensured a gut-wrenching feeling transpiring from deep within – I always feel bad when it plays, but it opens the floodgates to so many memories; granted they weren't very good ones. Letting out a sigh, I slowly rose to my feet, gotta get my mind off things. His saddened mood remained, and regularly I’d try to help ease his mood and at least give him a little bit of joy, but today; I’m tired.
target: 点击。它是同一条流的重播，世界毁灭的那一天。爸爸总是发现自己在我无法移开目光的时候关闭频道。他的严肃面孔确保了从内心深处传递出震撼人心的感觉——我总是感觉很糟糕，当它播放时，但它打开了许多记忆的大门；尽管它们并不是很好。叹口气，我慢慢站了起来，必须把注意力从事情上转移开来。他的心情仍然很沮丧，我经常试着帮助缓解他的心情，至少给他一点快乐，但今天；我累了。

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.
target: 我慢慢走向门口，喊了爸爸一声。“我出去一会儿，晚餐在冰箱里。”没有得到回应。好吧。爸爸总是能听见我的声音的，他应该没事的。我慢慢关上门，吐出一口气，门完全关上。差点忘了，我把手放在了冷冰冰的金属扫描器上，锁住了门。如果这个公寓有任何先进的技术的话，那就是它了。但是，大多数地方都有值得注意的技术——很长一段时间以来，没有人使用过任何其他不同的技术。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 漫长的等待后，我终于踏上了漫长的旅程——探索帕特里克斯城是那些逃离变异或纯粹幸运的人的特权。帕特里克斯城的夜晚美不胜收，闪烁着灿烂的恒星，这些恒星存在了数千年。天空一定是孤独的。帕特里克斯是一个很好的地方，但它感觉就像一个笼子而不是一个豪华的住所。房屋、公寓和任何能容纳住户的建筑物都被填满了，许多建筑物高达数百层楼，感谢伊格尼亚特。这种矿物质平息了技术和建筑，这是一种延长我们生命基础的伟大矿物质。然而，公众对这种矿物质知之甚少，主要是因为它被严格保密。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 摆脱杂念，找到了最喜欢的咖啡店，很多人避而远之，因为传言这里发现了漏洞，这是社会对感染了病毒的人的称呼，但我从来没有被这影响到，我一生都很幸运，店主是个好人，谁会放弃深夜聊天喝咖啡的机会呢？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进去，一个大铃声打破了我的不适，新煮的咖啡的香气充满了我的肺部。店主Anton当然是柜台后面的那个人——店里几乎是空的，除了后面的一些人。走到柜台时，我的双脚已经筋疲力尽了，我坐在一把椅子上，打了个哈欠。幸运的是，Anton带来了常规的。他的沙哑的声音在我的大脑的碎片中回荡：“嘿，莉莉特，夜晚很长吗？”“嗯，什么的，”我浅浅地回答，越来越累，越来越累。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 我已经准备好面对疲惫了，我喝了一口放在我面前的咖啡。“自从那次目击事件以来，生意就一直不景气······”我小声说道，试图不吓跑安东的柜台上剩下的顾客。安东点了点头，用一块布擦拭着一个玻璃杯——这家店本来是一家酒吧，但我从来没有真正来过。从后面传来几声低语，但大部分时间，我和安东的对话都很短。挥手道别，离开了这家店，感觉比之前多了些力气。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 晚上漫步在黑暗的小巷里通常不是最好的选择，但坦率地说，这比呆在那个闷热的公寓要好得多；大多数时候，你听到的不是自己的音乐，而是邻居在做爱。快速地喘息一口气，我转回目光看向前方——我可能会走向Al的珠宝店；只是一个我在业余时间发现有趣的废品的地方。快速地感到遗憾，因为我听到了脚步声，可能我想得太多了，但没有人会在这里逗留，除非他们想被抢劫，或者被打。这里是黑帮和帮派活动的聚集地······

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我悄悄地走向了商店的后面，金属格栅上传来低语和谈话，我用力撕掉金属格栅，爬进通风口是最安全、最安静的选择。爬进通风口后，我会听见穿着奇怪衣服的男人之间的对话和谈话。我注意到阿尔在里面，链子上锁着。我注意到他最终会被抓住。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔伯恩是个好人，但这看起来很严肃。没有必要插手别人的事，尤其是当他们似乎刚刚与整个城市的所有权威发生冲突时。尽管如此，我还是无法摆脱这种感觉。我叹了口气，慢慢地从格栅下爬了下来，掉进了安静的房间。“嘘，阿尔伯恩。阿尔伯恩！”我小声说，他没有回应。“莉莉丝？你在这里做什么..？你必须离开，他会抓住你的。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 我对自己小声说道，没有什么。试图解开围绕在他胳膊上的链子，声音围绕着我们的位置，微弱的脚步越来越响亮。“快！回到管道里，离开。不要回来。如果我们再次相遇，它不会是在这个城市。”他说着，脸上闪过一抹恐惧，我的神经一点也没有帮助。听从他的建议。我不能再留下去了。上帝，艾尔。我快速地离开了管道；失去这样的珍贵朋友真的很伤心。他们会把他转移到······其他城市吗？我对外围城市和感染了病毒的首都阿尔卡特拉兹（Alcatraz）做了许多研究，这个城市的名字与监狱很相似，从我读过的东西来看，确实很适合这个名字。不仅如此，未变异的人已经切断了与感染地的最后一块连接的陆地，这是······悲剧。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家路上很安静，但也很吵。我大脑中充斥的想法如洪水猛兽般席卷而来，遗憾没有留下来帮忙的念头不停地闪过。我终于回到了家，巨大的噪音从云层中爆发出来，雷鸣般的轰鸣足以吓到任何人。爸爸已经躺在沙发上睡着了，可能是一部10到12年前的电影重播，叹息着，我悄悄地回到了我的卧室。躺在床上，我无法长时间睁开眼睛。很快，我就沉沉睡去。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 在我意识到这一点之前，几天过去了。阿尔伯恩被带走已经过去几天了——我不知道他去了哪里，但我知道他去了哪里。这些服装看起来很熟悉，但我绝对不会在第一次尝试中搞清楚。叹气着，我把手放在我面前的系统上，发出红色和紫色光芒——我可以破解安全，地点不远，我怀疑他们采取了措施······也许我不应该。当然，在所有道德观念面前，我的手指没有意识到地移动，拉起了多个屏幕；天哪，我太厉害了。我在几个网站上很受欢迎，他们称我为“WRAITH”。这是一个很有吸引力的名字。尽管我的名字在任何网站上都是WR417H，但我喜欢认为公众起的名字。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 我把监控移到了我的移动设备上，仔细地看了每一个。什么都没有。就好像他们从来没有来过一样。这根本不合理。摄像头有严格的安全措施，即使是远程访问。怎么会这样？我愤怒地站着，准备从脑海中清除一些想法——我走过去，穿鞋，拿钥匙。“我很快就会回来，爸爸。”沉默。无所谓，他通常不会回应，总是忙于做一些比我更重要的事情。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 当我走出公寓时，我感觉到一阵急促的震动，震动从我的脊柱一直延伸到我身体的每个角落；这很奇怪。尽管如此，我鼓励自己去阿尔的酒吧调查一下，但我的腿却向安东的小酒吧走去——这是一个很安静的地方，我肯定需要和别人交谈。谁能比起一名欠你钱的酒吧服务员呢？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 不定期，Anton的生意还不错，热闹非凡，有我从未见过的新面孔——Anton经常是唯一的工人，所以我知道他一定很累。“嘿，吧台员，给我来一杯咖啡。”我故意用低沉的语气打扰他，看到他快速转身后松了一口气。“天啊，莉莉丝，不要这样对我······”他轻声说道，显然很累。“你看起来很忙······你需要一些帮助吗？看起来这里有很多人。”我喘息着，我不想帮助这些醉汉，但我觉得不好让这家伙一个人在外面工作。“你能帮我吗？我给你钱······”他用狗一样的眼睛直勾勾地盯着我，前进的战争战术······

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 巨大的特拉基从Thassalin的嘴里喷出了火焰，特拉基点燃了森林的一个特定区域，然后在空中盘旋了一会儿。奇怪的是，当他减速时，奇怪的尖叫声就停止了。Thassalin忘记了他背上有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我的飞行完全不同于被一条巨大的粉红色龙卷风突然拖走！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯尔显然不同意Nyssi，他看起来比正常情况下黑得少了，他的爪子扎进了Thassalin的背部，导致Thraki血流不止，但Thassalin看起来似乎并不在意。说起来，Thassalin已经意识到他吓到了他的新朋友，并找到了一个落脚点。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: “我道歉，但我闻到了气味。我不得不处理它！”

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你还要拖着我们一起走吗？” Tenuk一边爬下Thassalin的背上，一边滑下他的尾巴。“而且我们还留下了Retvik！我们抛弃了我们的大、强、凶悍的家伙！他怎么能找到我们呢？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: “他会解决的······” Nyssi皱着眉头说。“Retvik很慢，但他不是笨蛋。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: Nyssi眨了眨眼，转向Tenuk。“他当然能开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，显然不是。这个生物只是发出嘶吼，试图直接飞入Thassalin。幸运的是，尽管Thassalin的体型很大，但他还是灵活地躲开了，但Nyssi却不得不尖叫，因为她几乎失去了对Thassalin过于光滑的鳞片的控制。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: Thassalin发出嘶吼声，然后绕着山转了几圈。黑色怪物紧随其后，但当一股火焰从后面袭来时，它有些惊慌。Thassalin没有意识到它已经不再孤独了。它更加惊慌，Thassalin慢了下来，然后用尾巴击打了怪物的头部，使其偏离了轨道。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 咆哮着、咆哮着，怪物飞向上空，吐出一团火球。瞬间，天地一片漆黑，仿佛怪物正在吞噬天上的光芒，取而代之的是一片永无尽头的黑夜。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 失去了视力，Thassalin试图逃跑，但发现自己撞到了树线的顶端，然后摔进了一个空地。这个生物似乎知道Thassalin掉下来在哪里，直奔他而去，带着一片黑云。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: “凯尔！”特努克大喊一声，当他从云层中滑出并开始环绕时，试图在黑暗中找到Nyssi和Thassalin。“我们该怎么办？凯尔..？凯尔，你在哪里？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: Nyssi爬起来了。她几乎肯定自己受伤了，但她的奇怪、不自然的治愈能力已经启动了。与此同时，Thassalin坐在地上，躺在一棵尚未倒塌的树上休息。Nyssi尽力试图接近Thassalin，但她只能看到前方几米远的地方。周围一片漆黑，笼罩着邪恶的阴影。阴影中，有人在尖叫和尖叫。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 一条可怕的尾巴砸向Nyssi附近的地面，摔倒了她。Nyssi注意到尾巴在摆动，而不是瞄准她。这个生物，Nyssi能够看到和听到的一切，咆哮着和抓着它创造的影子。从黑暗中传来一个东西，刺向了怪物，混淆了它。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: “求求你！”埃尔文女王恳求道，“不要把她带走！她只是个孩子！”冰王子站在王位上，皇家顾问站在他旁边。她的女儿出生了。他皱着眉头。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 这位女孩和母亲长得十分相似，苍白的蓝色眼睛和白色的头发上点缀着蓝色的头发丝，冰王子觉得女儿会让他看起来很弱小。毕竟，到目前为止，他只生育过儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: “你只有两种选择，要么杀掉孩子，要么把它送到荒野去。这是对你罪行的惩罚，埃尔文。”他像吐毒一样吐出了她的名字。他总是这样做的。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 弗罗斯塔菲尔不是一个王国。它被分为北部和南部。北部是非魔法王国。南部是一个充满幻想的权力展示的王国。由于北部的贪婪，两个王国在一场永无休止的战争中相互冲突，直到南部提出停火。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方绝望了，他们的王室会做任何事情来阻止这场血腥事件。他们提供了唯一的公主作为北方的女王，生下一个儿子作为未来的国王。然后，南方将与北方合并为一个王国。北方接受了，埃尔文公主嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: “我求您了，我的国王，为了我孩子的安全，您可以对我做任何事情，关进监狱，驱逐我，甚至杀了我。”埃尔文女王跪在地上，紧紧抱着孩子，哀求国王。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王爷看向他的王后，满是厌恶的眼神。也许，也许，他会对她有所怜悯。二十二年来，他一直依赖她照顾自己，生育了他的儿子。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: “很好。孩子可能会住在宫里。”他开始，皇后叹了口气。“但是，”他补充道。“你会被处死。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和女王埃尔文本人都露出恐惧的神情。她慢慢地看着地板。“是啊，我的国王。”她鞠躬。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
target: 她翻到空白页，把日期写在上面。下面，她写了“5/11/648——12/13/648”。

source: “Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “回忆往事？”伊芙看了看那本旧笔记，问道。卡里点了点头。“他们会在圣诞节放你出去吗？只剩几天了。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡里两次敲击灯笼。是的，正如伊芙预言的那样。冰王爷从来没有让卡里出去，因为她在他的眼中是“一个缺陷”。卡里出生就是哑巴，而且她是家里唯一的女孩，因为家里都是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 犀牛也一样。犀牛出现在非二元性别时，世界似乎也发生了变化。犀牛被剥夺了大部分时间独自工作的机会，这是对他们不同身份的惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们还被迫作为公主的仆人工作，但他们并不介意，因为他们也有了一个朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “快要过生日了，不是吗？”伊芙问，想起公主的生日在几天后。卡里点了点头，眼中闪过一抹悲伤的光芒。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: “你想庆祝吗？”他们问她，回想起她上次回答时的样子。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 不。卡里退出了比赛。伊芙知道这是一门难题。它是她被关在房间里，母亲被驱逐的那一天。伊芙当时还只是个婴儿，但他们记得仆人们和镇上的居民是多么愤怒。他们听说埃尔文女王是一个好女王，但也奇怪地预测了会发生的事情。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: “那······你想做什么？”他们问道。卡里兴奋地望着他们。然后，她把一张纸递给了伊芙。他们看了看那张纸······

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 0430意大利时间。科伦 (Cohren)不喜欢这么早起床。主要是因为他负责在他的公司里叫醒其他人。安静地从他的宿舍里走出来，穿上他的战斗休闲服，披上他的防弹背心，然后从他的储物柜里拿出他的行李，特别小心地拿出一个特别小的盒子。他肩负起他的步枪，戴上他的头盔，头盔挂在他的腰带上。它有所有的固定装置，呼吸器，护目镜，所有需要的东西。检查他的弹夹后，他悄悄地走出了营房，泥土和冰在他的靴子下咯咯作响。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从夹在夹克口袋里的打火机和另一只烟中取出打火机，点燃了烟，吸了一口，微微打开了门。上周，他不得不想出办法叫醒他所指挥的男性和女性。现在，他不再使用预设的叫醒报警器，一半的时间，报警器根本不起作用，只有轻微的嗡嗡声从扬声器中传出。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: “叫醒他们”科伦转过身，看到2号中尉尼米克走了过来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 他还没来得及回答，门就打开了，哈里斯、克雷斯和几个人匆匆离开，已经穿戴整齐。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，应该在路上了，我们给他们留了时间去餐厅取食物。”0500，埃及斯公司在机动车库集合，肖先生上了一个箱子，开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: “我们要前往I-131 FOB，距离伊安洛斯50英里。我们要支援伊安洛斯的围攻和后续进攻，清除当地的武装分子。从那里，我们将有一个据点和山区的基地。”肖解释道。“跟你的小队合作，骑上马。”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 公司分散了，部队和班长组合在一起，坐上了其中一辆坦克。科伦爬上了一辆坦克，加入了尼米克、克雷思和两名新兵。科伦记得他们几天前到达，但对他们了解不多。坐在一边，伸出腿侧坐着，他调整了背包和无线电，连接到耳机和喉麦。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: “嘿，科伦，哈里斯还在养雪球吗？”尼米克问道。

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你说的是他偷来的鸡吗？”科伦记得当天早上他们从一家农场偷走了他。“是的，我很肯定。”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦瞥了一眼另一只箱子，发现哈里斯带着他的小队。从他的背包后面，他就能看到一只小鸡在转动头部，扫视周围。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: “是的，他仍然有他”科伦回答，坦克炮塔舱门咯吱咯吱地打开，坦克指挥官出现在视野中。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有坦克都在向前移动”指挥官开始平静但明确地对着他的耳机说。坦克连队和斯特赖克的发动机轰鸣着开始向前移动。克罗诺斯·科伦（Kronos Cohren）被震撼了，因为它的刹车松开了，向前移动，进入了阵型。坦克在伊塔尼亚平原上形成了楔形阵型。冬季风暴已经冻结了沼泽和森林，但泥土总是存在的。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 过了大约一小时，新招募的科伦（Cohren）想起了自己的名字是欧森（Orson），举手发言。“上尉，你是从战争开始就一直待在这里的吧？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: “是的，火暴行动，”科伦回答。“我们认为这会在几周内结束，但······我们低估了他们”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising. With our recent discovery of Ignniat, humanity has once skyrocketed past its peak; the greatest has yet to be achieved. This grace of newfound knowledge could only be described as divine intervention - we humanity will be able to grace the gods with our presence in their land in the clouds. Everyone within the company of Karascene has evaluated Ignniat and we sense a large potential within this mineral – worry not, Ignniat has not been evaluated to have any side effects or downsides of being mined, it has a higher chance to–
target: 人类的进步从未停止过，即便在困难时期，我们又开始成长和适应。城市依然繁荣昌盛，我们科技的进步也在不断上升。在我们最近发现Ignniat之后，人类已经跃升到了一个前所未有的高峰。这份新的知识的恩赐可以用神圣的介入来形容——我们人类将有机会在云端与神同在他们的土地上。Karascene公司内的每个人都对Ignniat进行了评估，我们感觉到它蕴藏着巨大的潜能——不要担心，Ignniat并没有评估出任何副作用或开采时的不利之处，它的潜力更高。

source: A click. It had been reruns of this same stream, the day the world was ruined. Dad always found himself turning the channel off when I was unable to tear my eyes away. The somber face he gave me ensured a gut-wrenching feeling transpiring from deep within – I always feel bad when it plays, but it opens the floodgates to so many memories; granted they weren't very good ones. Letting out a sigh, I slowly rose to my feet, gotta get my mind off things. His saddened mood remained, and regularly I’d try to help ease his mood and at least give him a little bit of joy, but today; I’m tired.
target: 噗通一声。那天，世界毁灭了。爸爸总是关闭这个频道，当我无法从眼睛里分开视线时。他严肃的表情让我感到一股沉重的情绪涌上心头，我总是想帮他缓解情绪，至少给他一些快乐，但今天，我很疲倦。我慢慢地站起身来，我必须把注意力转移到其他事情上。他的悲伤情绪一直存在，我经常试图帮助他缓解情绪，至少给他一些快乐，但今天，我很疲倦。

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.
target: 我慢慢地靠近门口，向爸爸大喊一声，“我要出去一会儿，晚餐放在冰箱里了。”没有回应，估计没人听到。我慢慢地关上门，深呼一口气，门完全关上了。差点忘记了，我把手放在那把冷冰冰的金属扫描仪上，它锁住了门。如果这个公寓有什么，那就是先进的科技，但另一方面，大多数地方都有先进的科技，那已经很久没有使用过任何不同的科技了。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 那个冷雨的夜晚，我终于走出了家门，去探索帕尔特里克斯的城市。逃过了变异的幸存者，或是纯粹是运气好的幸存者，那个城市的夜晚是幸存者们的福音。那个城市的夜晚是美丽的，被绚丽的星光所照亮，那些星星在几千年里都没有熄灭。那个城市的夜晚是寂寞的，那个城市的夜晚是幸福的。帕尔特里克斯是一个很好的城市，但它感觉更像一个笼子，而不是一个舒适的家。那里充满了公寓、房子和任何能容纳住住户的建筑物，大多数建筑物都超过了几百米高，感谢伊格尼亚特。那个能平息技术和建筑的矿物质是非常好的矿物质，它延长了我们生命的基础。公共知识只知道一些关于这个矿物质的事，主要是因为它被保密得很严密。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 甩掉迷雾，我找到了我最喜欢的咖啡店，大部分人都避而远之，因为流传着该地区有漏洞，这是社会对被病毒感染的人所说的话，这从来没有影响到我，我一生都很幸运，加上老板是个好人，谁会拒绝免费的咖啡换取夜里聊天呢？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进店里，一阵喧闹的敲门声把我的不适一扫而空，咖啡的香气充满了我的肺腑，店里只有柜台后几个人，柜台前的人都坐在椅子上休息，我靠在一把椅子上，眯着眼睛打了个喷嚏。走到柜台前，我疲惫不堪的双脚蜷缩在一把椅子上，打了个喷嚏。我看到安东坐在柜台前，“晚上好吗？”他粗哑的声音在我的脑海中回荡，“嗯，很晚了。”我浅薄地回应。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 我喝了一口前面摆放的咖啡，准备缓解疲劳。我小心翼翼地说：“自从那次见面后，生意就一直不好······”我低声说，不试图吓走安东尼的顾客。他点了点头，用一块布擦了擦杯子。这家咖啡馆实际上是一家酒吧，但我从来没有来这里喝酒。我从后面听到了一些哼哼的声音，但大部分时间，我和安东尼之间的对话很短。我向他挥了挥手，然后离开了咖啡馆。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 晚上漫步在昏暗的小巷并不常见，但正直说来比呆家里好得多；至少这里的气氛较为舒适些。我深呼吸了一口冷空气——或许回到前面那条小路吧······也可能是为了看一下别人的闲置物品而走过来的——这就像是一份兼职工作一样。当听到了后方脚步声的时候我的心情瞬间变坏了起来：似乎有人跟着我们过去（尽管没有看到他们）、而且大部分时候你会觉得自己更喜欢聆听性交相关的话题—如果不是因为这个原因那么就是由于音乐太吵闹所致。这是一个以贩毒和打斗闻名的大街区······

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我悄悄地走到店后面，在金属格栅后面传来了哼哼的声音和谈话，金属格栅很容易脱落。进入通风口是我现在最安全和安静的选择。我爬到通风口，听到了两名穿着奇怪服装的男人的对话和谈话。我注意到Al在里面，被铐住了。他最终会被抓到。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔本是个好人，但这看起来很严肃。我不需要插手别人的事，尤其是当他们似乎刚刚惹上了整个城市的所有权威时。然而，我还是无法摆脱这种感觉。我轻声说了一句：“阿尔本，阿尔本！”我轻声说了一句：“莉莉斯？你在这里干什么？你得走，他会抓住你。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 我在心里对自己说道，试图撬开围着他的绳索。声音越来越靠近我们所在的地方。“快！赶紧回到通风口中去并离这里远点。”他急切地告诉了我一句话：“不要再留下多久啦”听完这段建议后我的神经开始紧张起来——从未想过会有这样一个朋友永别人世；但事实就是如此······他们将其转移到了另一个城市？那是不是意味着一切都会变得更糟糕呢············哦好吧 ······.我匆忙进入隧洞时感到一些疼痛——这位忠诚友好的战士不复存在让本来就很沮丧的人更加伤感；至于那些外面被感染的大都市和阿尔卡特雷兹监狱（这是由这种病毒所命名）之间的联系已断绝而没有任何可能重新建立也无可厚非······

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家的路上很安静，但很吵，脑子里灌输的思绪一波接一波，后悔没有留下来帮忙的念头一波接一波，最后终于回到家了，回到家的路上吓得我差点哭出来，天上响雷的声音，有时候会吓到人，爸爸已经在沙发上睡着了，可能十几年前的某部电影的重播，大概是十几年前的某部电影的重播，哼哼，我悄悄地回到自己的房间，在床上翻来覆去，一会儿就睡着了。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 我在不知不觉中度过了几天，直到我意识到这一点。阿尔本被带走已经好几天了，我根本不知道他去了哪里，但我知道他被带走了。这些服装似乎很熟悉，但我绝对不会在第一次尝试就猜出来。我把手放在我面前的系统上，散发着红色和紫色的光芒，我知道我可以入侵安全系统，距离那里也不远，而且我怀疑他们没有采取任何措施······也许我不应该。当然，在所有道德的背叛下，我的手指在不知不觉中移动了好几个屏幕，神啊，我真的很厉害。我在几个网站上很受欢迎，他们把我称为“WRAITH”。这是一个很有吸引力的名字。虽然我的名字在任何网站上都是WR417H，但我认为是公众给我起的名字。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 把监控移到我的移动设备上，我盯着它们看了很久。什么都没有。他们永远都不在那里。这太不可思议了。摄像头有严格的安全措施，即使是远程访问也如此。怎么办？我愤怒地站着，准备把一些想法从脑海中赶走——我走了过来，穿着鞋子，拿着钥匙。“我很快回来，爸爸。”寂静。不管怎样，他通常不会回复我，即使他在做更重要的事情也不例外。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 一阵急颤过后，我感觉到一阵颤栗从后背一路向下蔓延，我走出公寓的那一刻；奇怪。忽视这种感觉，我勉强自己朝着Al的方向前进，去调查一下，但我的腿却向着Anton的小酒吧走去，那里很安静，而且我确实需要有人聊天；谁比酒吧老板欠我钱更合适呢？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 偶尔安东的生意还不错，人来客往的人很多了 —因为他总是独一员工在店里工作、我从没见过的新面孔；而且平常只有他的时候才会有人帮忙——所以知道自己肯定要很累。“嘿吧台服务人员大哥快给带杯咖啡。”为了让这家伙开口少说话些而故弄虚作地用低音去跟他们打招呼（哈哈）看着脸上的表情显然疲惫到了极点。“对啊莉丝······别这样做······”他憋得喘不过气：看到利希特那张舒服无比微笑时我的心也软下来了一下。

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 塔萨林的颚部喷出一股火焰，巨大的特拉基人点燃了一片特定的森林，然后绕过头，凝视了一会儿。奇怪的是，当他减速时，他后面的奇怪的嘶吼声突然停止了。塔萨林忘记了他背后有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我的飞行完全不同于被一头巨大的粉红色龙卷风卷走！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯尔明显不赞成尼西，他看起来比平时更黑了，他的爪子深深地刺入了塔萨林的背部，使他流血，但塔萨林似乎并不在乎。在此之前，塔萨林意识到他吓到了他的新朋友，并找到了一个空旷的地方着陆。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: “我道歉，但我闻到了味道。我不得不面对它！”

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你们也要拖着我们走吗？” Tenuk爬上Thassalin的背上，滑下他的尾巴。“我们把Retvik留在了后面！我们抛弃了我们的大、强壮、斗志昂扬的家伙！他怎么会找到我们？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: 尼西笑着说：“他会解决问题的。”尼西笑着说：“退维克很慢，但他不是傻子。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: 尼西眯起眼睛，转身回到Tenuk身边。他说：“当然，他可以开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，显然不是。那个生物只是咆哮，试图直接飞向塔萨林。幸运的是，尽管体型庞大，塔萨林还是灵活地躲开了，但尼西无法避免地大喊，因为她几乎失去了对塔萨林过于光滑的鳞片的抓住。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: 塔萨林发出一声尖叫，然后绕着山转了一圈，更靠近它的家园。那只黑色的怪物紧随其后，但有些慌乱，因为一股火焰从后面袭来。那个怪物意识到自己不再孤单了。它更加慌乱，因为塔萨林减慢了速度，然后用尾巴拍打怪物的头部，使其偏离了方向。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 那个生物发出咆哮和咆哮声，飞向天空，吐出了空气。一切都变得漆黑，好像怪物正在从天空中吸取光芒，换成一片永远的黑暗。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 失去视力后，Thassalin试图退缩，但发现自己撞到了天线的顶端，然后撞到了一个空旷地带，那个怪物似乎知道Thassalin掉在哪里，直奔Thassalin，带走了黑色的云团。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: Tenuk惊呼“Kayel！”他滑出云层，开始绕圈，试图在黑暗中寻找Nyssi和Thassalin。Tenuk喊道：“我们该怎么办？Kayel······Kayel，你在哪里？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: 尼西坐起身来，她很确定自己受伤了，但奇怪的是，她的奇怪的、自然的愈合能力已经开始起作用了。与此同时，塔萨林躺在地上，靠着那一棵还没有倒塌的树休息。尼西尽力想要接近塔萨林，但她只能看到自己面前的几米远的地方。一切都是漆黑的，笼罩在邪恶的阴影之中。而在这些阴影之中，有什么东西在叫喊和咆哮。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 在尼西附近的一处草丛中，一尾被打断的尾巴撞到了地上，将她推倒在地。尼西注意到，尾巴并不是瞄准她，而是挥舞着。那个动物，尼西所能看到和听到的一点点，正在咆哮和抓着它所创造的阴影。黑暗中有什么东西穿过，刺向那个怪物，让它迷路。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: 皇后艾瑞温哀求道：“不要把她送走！她只是个孩子！”冰国国王冷冷地瞪着妻子，旁边是他的王室顾问。她生了一个女儿。他瞪着这个想法。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 这位女孩和她的母亲长得很像，蓝色的眼睛和白色的头发上缀着蓝色的辫子，冰国王觉得女儿让他看起来很弱小，毕竟到目前为止，他只生过儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: 他吐出她的名字，就像是毒蛇一样。他总是这么做的。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 冻霜王国并不是一个王国。它被分成两部分，北方和南方。北方是非魔法王国，南方是充满奇幻力量的王国。由于北方的贪婪，这两个王国在永无休止的战争中互相对抗，直到南方提出了一项停火协议。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方陷入困境，他们的王室会做任何事情来阻止流血。他们将唯一的公主献给北方，成为北方的女王，并生一个儿子成为未来的国王。然后，南方和北方联合起来，建立一个王国。北方接受了，公主艾尔文嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: 埃尔文王后恳求道：“为了我的孩子的安全，你可以做任何你想做的事，把我关起来，驱逐我，甚至杀了我。”她紧紧抱着自己的孩子。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王看着他的女王，厌恶的眼神。也许，也许，他会对她有所怜悯。二十二年来一直照顾着他的女人，在他最困难的时候一直在照顾着他，生育了他的儿子。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: 他说：“很好，孩子可以住在宫里。”这引起了女王的叹息。他接着说：“但”，“你将被处死。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和女王伊尔文本人都露出了惊恐的表情。她慢慢地看着地板。她说：“是的，我的王子。”她跪了下来。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
“Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “回顾旧时光？”伊沃询问，看着旧的笔记本。卡里点头。她说：“你认为他们会在圣诞节放你出去吗？距离圣诞节还有几天。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡里两次点亮蜡烛，没错，就像伊芙预测的那样，冰国王从一开始就没有让卡里出去，他认为卡里是“一个缺点”，她出生时就哑了，她是这个家庭唯一的女孩，因为这个家庭全部都是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 伊维也一样，在他们自己的方式上。当伊维出现在非二元性时，似乎世界也发生了变化。他们被赋予那些会让他们大部分时间独自待在家中的工作，作为惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们还被迫当公主的侍从，他们并没有太在意，因为他们也结识了一个朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “快过你的生日了，没错吧？”伊娃问道，记得公主的生日在几天后。卡里点点头，她的蓝色眼睛里带着一丝悲伤。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: 他们问：“你想庆祝吗？”他们回顾了她上次回答这个问题时的情形。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 没有。卡里被击倒了。伊沃知道这对她来说是一件很难的事情。那天，她被关在房间里，她的母亲被驱逐了。伊沃那时还很小，但他们记得那天仆人和镇民们的愤怒。他们听说伊沃妃是个温和的女王，但他们还奇怪地预测会发生什么。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: 他们问：“你们想干什么？”卡里抬头看着他们，兴奋不已。她把纸递给伊沃瑞，伊沃瑞看了看纸，然后······

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 0430意大利时间。科伦讨厌在这么早的时候起床。主要是因为他负责唤醒周围的人。他悄悄地离开营房，穿上战斗服，穿上战术背心，从锁柜里拿出自己的东西，小心翼翼地拿出一个特别的小盒子。他抬起步枪，把头盔挂在腰带上的一个小挂钩上。它有所有的固定件，呼吸器，护目镜，所有需要的东西。他检查了弹药袋，然后悄悄地离开营房，泥泞的地面和冰块在他的靴子下瑟瑟发抖。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从衬衫口袋里拿出一支烟，从另一个口袋里拿出一支点火机。他点燃点火机，然后轻轻打开车门。在过去的一周里，他不得不想办法唤醒他的下属。他停止使用预设的闹钟，因为大部分情况下，它从扬声器中传来的只是轻微的噼噼啪啪的声音。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: 科伦转身看见二级军衔Nemic走上前来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 他还没来得及回答，门就打开了，哈里斯、克雷斯特和几个其他人匆匆忙忙地跑了出去，已经穿好了衣服，装好了行李。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，他们应该在路上了，我们给他们时间去从食堂里拿食物”零点五十分准时，埃克塞度公司在摩托池集合。肖在一辆箱子上站了起来，开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: Shaw解释道：“我们要去FOB I-131，距离Ianlos五十英里外。我们要支持持续的围困和伊安诺斯的进攻，以清除那里的叛乱。从那里开始，我们会有一个据点和山脚下的基地。”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 公司分散了，在队列和排长的带领下，他们都登上了其中的一辆坦克。科伦自己登上了另一辆坦克，加入了Nemic、Craith和两名新招募的士兵。科伦记得他们几天前刚到达，但对他们了解不多。坐在一边，悬着一条腿，他调整了他的包和对讲机，它连接到耳机和喉部麦克风。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: 当他们定居下来时，Nemic问道：“嘿，科伦，哈里斯还有雪球吗？”

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你说的是他偷来的鸡吗？”科伦记得那天他们从农场上偷走了他。“是的，我很确定。”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦瞥了一眼另一辆坦克，看到了哈里斯和他的部队。从他的背后，他可以看到一只小鸡在转动头部，扫视周围。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: 科伦回答道：“是的，他还在那里。”当炮塔盖子打开时，这辆坦克的指挥官露出头来。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有的坦克都在移动”指挥官缓缓地开始，但明显地对着耳机说话。一辆坦克和斯特里克突击队的发动机响了起来，它们开始向前移动。克罗诺斯·科伦的发动机熄火了，它开始向前移动，形成了队列。坦克们形成了三角形，在伊塔尼亚平原上移动。冬季风暴已经冻结了沼泽和森林，但泥总是留在那里。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 大约一个小时后，新招募人员科伦记起了他的名字是奥森，站了起来。他说：“上校，你从战争开始以来一直在这里，对吗？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: 科伦回答道：“是的，火暴行动”，“我们以为会在几周内结束，但······我们低估了他们”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising. With our recent discovery of Ignniat, humanity has once skyrocketed past its peak; the greatest has yet to be achieved. This grace of newfound knowledge could only be described as divine intervention - we humanity will be able to grace the gods with our presence in their land in the clouds. Everyone within the company of Karascene has evaluated Ignniat and we sense a large potential within this mineral – worry not, Ignniat has not been evaluated to have any side effects or downsides of being mined, it has a higher chance to–
target: 人类的进步从未停止，哪怕片刻——在艰难时期，我们再次成长并适应。城市一如既往地繁荣，我们的技术进步正在上升。随着我们最近对Ignniat的发现，人类已经迅速超越了巅峰；最伟大的成就还未实现。这种新知识的恩赐只能被描述为神的介入——我们人类将能够以我们的存在荣耀神明，进入他们云中的领地。Karascene公司的每个人都已经评估了Ignniat，我们感觉到这种矿物蕴含着巨大的潜力——不必担心，Ignniat尚未被评估出任何采矿的副作用或缺点，它有更高的可能性——

source: A click. It had been reruns of this same stream, the day the world was ruined. Dad always found himself turning the channel off when I was unable to tear my eyes away. The somber face he gave me ensured a gut-wrenching feeling transpiring from deep within – I always feel bad when it plays, but it opens the floodgates to so many memories; granted they weren't very good ones.
