Letting out a sigh, I slowly rose to my feet, gotta get my mind off things. His saddened mood remained, and regularly I’d try to help ease his mood and at least give him a little bit of joy, but today; I’m tired.
target: 一声点击。那是世界毁灭那天的重播，爸爸总是在我无法移开视线时，自己关掉频道。他给我的那张阴沉的脸，确保了一种从内心深处涌出的揪心感觉——每当它播放时，我总是感到难过，但它打开了许多记忆的闸门；当然，这些记忆并不美好。我叹了口气，慢慢站起身，得让自己从这些事情中转移注意力。他的悲伤情绪依旧，我经常试图帮助他缓解心情，至少给他一点快乐，但今天，我累了。

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.
target: 我以相对缓慢的步伐走向门口，向爸爸喊了一声：“我出去一会儿，晚餐在冰箱里。”没有回应。果然如此。他通常能听到我的声音，他可能没事的。我慢慢关上门，当门完全关闭时，我再次发出一声叹息。差点忘了，我将手放在冰冷的金属扫描器上，它锁住了门。这个公寓里有的，就是先进的科技，但话说回来，大多数地方都有显著的技术——已经很久没有人使用过其他不同的技术了。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 那个寒冷多雨的夜晚，我终于踏上了久违的探索之旅——对于那些通过逃离或纯粹的幸运而免于变异的人来说，探索帕特里库斯城是一种特权。城市之夜美丽极了，被璀璨的恒星照亮，这些恒星已经存在了数千年。在遥远的天空中，一定很孤独吧。帕特里库斯是个不错的地方，但感觉更像一个笼子，而不是一个豪华的居住地。这里到处都是公寓、房屋和其他任何能容纳居住者的建筑，大多数建筑都有数百层高；这要归功于伊格尼亚特。这种矿物安抚了科技，也是建筑的伟大矿物，它扩展了我们生命的基础。然而，公众对这种矿物的了解并不多，主要是因为它被严格保密。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 我摆脱了纷乱的思绪，找到了我最喜欢的咖啡店；大多数人会避开那里，因为有传言说该地区发现了一名感染者，这是社会对那些被病毒感染的人的称呼。但这从未真正困扰过我，我一生中运气极佳，而且店主是个很棒的人。谁会拒绝在深夜免费喝咖啡，只为了聊天呢？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进店内，一阵响亮的铃声驱散了我的不适，新鲜冲泡的咖啡香气充盈了我的肺部。当然，站在柜台后面的是店主安东——除了后面角落里坐着的几个人，店里几乎空无一人。我拖着因长途步行而疲惫的双脚，靠在其中一个凳子上，打了个哈欠。我看到安东正不慌不忙地准备着常规的咖啡。“嘿，莉莉丝，昨晚很晚吗？”他沙哑的声音在大脑的分形中回响，“算是吧，”我敷衍地回答，每秒都感到更加疲惫。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 我准备好了要解决我的疲劳，于是喝了几口放在面前的咖啡。“自从那次目击事件后，生意还是不好吗？”我轻声说，没有试图吓走安东单位剩下的顾客。他点了点头，用抹布擦着玻璃——这个地方技术上来说是一家酒吧，但我从来不是来喝酒的。后面传来了几声低语，但总的来说，我和安东之间的对话今晚相当简短。我向他挥手告别，离开了店铺；比之前更有精神了。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 深夜在黑暗的街道上游荡通常不是最好的选择，但说实话，这比待在那个闷热的公寓里要好；很多时候，你听到邻居做爱的声音比听到自己的音乐还多。我迅速地叹了口气，将目光移回前方的路——我可能会去阿尔的当铺；那只是一个我找些看起来有趣的垃圾的地方，作为消遣。当我听到脚步声从后面传来时，我迅速地后悔了，也许我多想了，但没有人会在这里闲逛，除非他们想被抢劫或殴打。这里因黑手党和帮派活动而闻名……

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我悄悄地向商店的后部走去，透过一个需要用力拉扯才能扯下的金属格栅，我听到了低语和谈话声。现在对我来说，爬进通风口是最安全、最安静的选择；我一边爬，一边能听到那些穿着奇怪的男人之间的对话。我注意到阿尔在里面，被锁着。他最终被抓住，这并不奇怪。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔伯恩是个好家伙，但这看起来很严重。没必要为别人冒险，特别是当他们看起来好像刚惹上城里所有当权者的麻烦时。然而，我仍然无法摆脱那种感觉。我轻声叹了口气，慢慢从下面的格栅上消失，降落在安静的房间里。“嘿，阿尔。阿尔！”我小声喊道，对他没有反应感到惊讶。“莉莉丝？你在这里做什么...？你得离开，他会抓住你的。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 我默默地对自己说：“没错。”我试图撬开缠绕在他手臂上的锁链，这时，有声音逼近我们的位置，微弱的脚步声越来越响。“快！回到通风管里，离开。不要回来。如果我们再次相遇，那不会是在这个城市。”他匆忙地说，他脸上的恐慌一闪而过，这丝毫没有缓解我的紧张。听了他的建议，我无法让自己再待下去。该死的，阿尔。我迅速跑出通风管；失去这么一个宝贵的朋友，有点痛。他们要把他移到……另一个城市吗？我的思绪有点混乱，大多数都是愤怒但悲伤的。我做了很多关于外城的研究，以及被感染者的首都——阿卡迪亚，他们以监狱命名——从我读到的来看，感觉这个名字很贴切。更不用说，未变异者已经切断了与被感染土地的所有连接，这……太悲剧了。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家的路很安静，但又如此喧闹。那些侵袭我大脑的想法在轰鸣，没有留下来帮忙的遗憾多次闪过。我终于到家了，几乎被头顶云层中爆发出的可怕声音所吓哭，雷鸣般的轰响有时足以吓到任何人。爸爸已经倒在沙发上睡着了，可能在重播一部10到12年前的电影；我叹了口气，悄悄地溜回自己的房间。倒在床上，我无法长时间保持眼睛睁开。不久，睡意袭来。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 日子在我不知不觉中流逝。阿尔伯恩被带走已经几天了——我不知道他被带到了哪里，但我知道他被带到了某个地方。那些装扮看起来很眼熟，但我绝不会在第一次尝试时就弄清楚。我叹了口气，把手放在面前的系统上，发出红紫色的光芒——我可以黑进安保系统，这个地方不远，而且我怀疑他们没有采取措施……也许我不应该这么做。当然，违背所有道德，我的手指在我不知不觉中移动，拉出多个屏幕；天哪，我太厉害了。我在几个网站上相当受欢迎，他们称我为“WRAITH”。这是一个相当吸引人的名字。虽然在任何网站上我的名字都是WR417H，但我喜欢认为这是公众想出来的。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 我将监控转移到我的移动设备上，仔细观察每一个画面。什么都没有。就像它们从未存在过一样。这没有道理。摄像头有严密的安保措施，即使有远程访问也是如此。怎么会...？哎呀。我愤怒地站起身，准备摆脱一些想法——我走过去，穿上鞋子，拿起钥匙。“我很快回来，爸爸。”沉默。不管怎样，他通常不会回应，他可能正忙着做比我更重要的事情。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 我迅速一震，感到一阵寒意沿着我的脊椎向下蔓延，当我走出公寓时；真奇怪。我忽略这种感觉，催促自己去Al's那里调查一下，但我的腿却向Anton的小酒吧走去——那是一个相当平静的地方，我确实需要和某人谈谈。谁比一个欠你东西的调酒师更合适呢？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 不规律地，安东的酒吧相当忙碌；它充满了活动和我从未见过的新面孔——安东通常是唯一的工作人员，所以我知道他一定压力很大。“嘿，酒保，给我来杯咖啡。”我故意用低沉的语调说话，想让他有点分心，看到他迅速转身后的如释重负的叹息，我不禁轻笑。“天哪，莉莉丝，别这样对我……”他轻声说道，显然很累。“你看起来很忙……你需要帮忙吗？看起来这里人多得不得了。”我哼了一声，我不想帮助这些醉汉，但我觉得让这家伙独自在这里工作很不好。“你能吗？我之后会付钱给你的……”他用小狗般的眼神直视着我，恳求道。高级战争策略……

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 当这位巨大的特拉基人点燃一片特定的森林时，塔萨林的口中喷出一团火焰，然后在上空盘旋，观察了一会儿。奇怪的是，随着他放慢速度，身后那奇怪的尖叫声也停止了。塔萨林忘记了他背上还有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我自己的飞行和被一只巨大的粉红色龙突然拖走完全不同！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯尔显然不同意尼西的说法，他看起来比平时更不黑，而且他的爪子已经深深嵌入了塔萨林的背部，以至于让塔萨林流血了，但塔萨林显然并不在意。话虽如此，塔萨林意识到他吓到了他的新朋友们，于是找了一个空地降落。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: “对不起，我闻到了一股气味。我不得不处理一下！”

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你们也得把我们拖着走吗？”特努克一边从塔萨林背上滑下来，一边不耐烦地说，“我们把雷特维克留在后面了！我们抛弃了那个又大又壮、爱打架的家伙！他怎么才能找到我们？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: “他会解决的……”尼西叹了口气，“雷特维克虽然慢，但并不笨。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: 尼西眨了眨眼，转过身来对特努克说：“他当然会开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，显然不是。那生物只是嘶嘶作响，试图直接飞向塔萨林。幸运的是，尽管体型庞大，塔萨林还是足够灵活地躲开了，但尼西丝还是忍不住尖叫起来，她差点就抓不住塔萨林那过于光滑的鳞片了。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: 塔萨林发出嘶嘶声，然后绕行，靠近他称之为家的那座山。那头黑暗的野兽跟在后面，但当一股火焰从后面击中它时，它有些惊慌。那生物没有意识到它不再孤单。当塔萨林放慢速度，然后用尾巴拍打野兽的头部时，它更加惊慌，偏离了方向。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 那生物咆哮着，嘶嘶作响，飞向空中，向空中喷吐着。一切突然变得黑暗，仿佛那怪物正在从天空本身吸走光线，取而代之的是永恒的黑夜之云。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 再也看不见了，塔萨林试图撤退，但发现自己正刮擦着树梢，然后撞进了一片空地。那生物似乎清楚地知道塔萨林跌落的位置，径直朝他冲去，黑暗的云团也随之而来。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: “凯尔！”特努克一边滑出云层，一边开始盘旋，试图在下面的黑暗中找到尼西和塔萨林。“我们该怎么办？凯尔……？凯尔，你在哪儿？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: 下面，Nyssi挣扎着站了起来。她确信自己肯定骨折了，但她那奇怪的、超自然的愈合能力已经启动了。Thassalin就没那么幸运了，他瘫成一团，靠在唯一一棵没有被他的重量压垮的树上。Nyssi尽力想接近Thassalin，但她只能勉强看到前方几米远的地方。一切漆黑一片，被不祥的阴影笼罩着。在这些阴影中，有什么东西在尖叫和嘶叫。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 一条可怕的、像棍子一样的尾巴砸向了Nyssi附近的地面，把她撞倒了。但她注意到，尾巴在乱舞，没有瞄准她。那生物，Nyssi能看见和听见的那部分，正在咆哮并抓挠它自己造成的阴影。有东西在黑暗中瞬移，刺向怪物，让它感到困惑。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: “求求你！”艾尔文女王恳求道，“不要把她送走！她还只是个孩子！”冰王从王座上俯视着他的妻子，他的皇家顾问站在他旁边。她生了一个女孩。一想到这个，他就皱起了眉头。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 那个女孩和她母亲长得非常像；苍白的蓝眼睛和点缀着蓝丝的白发。冰王觉得有个女儿让他看起来很软弱。毕竟，到目前为止，他只有儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: “你只有两个选择，要么杀死孩子，要么把它送进荒野。这是你犯错的惩罚，艾尔文。”他吐出她的名字，好像那是毒药。他总是这样。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 弗罗斯特费尔并非一直是一个王国。它被分为两部分，北方和南方。北方是一个非魔法王国，而南方则是一个充满奇幻力量展示的王国。由于北方的贪婪，两个王国陷入了无休止的战争，直到南方提出休战。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方已经绝望，他们的王室会不惜一切代价阻止流血。他们提出将唯一的公主嫁给北方的王子，生下一个儿子作为未来的国王。然后，南方将与北方联合，成为一个王国。北方接受了这个提议，伊尔文公主嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: “求求你，我的国王，为了我孩子的安全，你对我做什么都行，把我关起来，流放我，甚至杀了我。”艾尔文女王恳求道，紧紧抱着怀中的孩子。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王低头看着他的王后，眼中满是厌恶。也许，只是也许，他会对她手下留情。这个他相伴了二十二年的女人，这个总是在他最落魄时照顾他的女人，这个为他生下儿子的女人。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: “很好，孩子可以住在宫里。”他开始说，引得王后叹了口气。“但是，”他补充道，“你将被处决。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和伊尔文女王本人都露出了惊恐的神情。她缓缓低头看着地面。“是的，我的国王。”她行了礼。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
target: 她翻到一页空白处，写下了日期。在下面，她写道：“5/11/648 - 12/13/648。”

source: “Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “翻看旧回忆？”象牙看着那本旧笔记本问道。卡莉点了点头。“你觉得他们会让你在圣诞节时出去吗？离圣诞节只有几天了。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡莉敲了两次灯笼。不，正如象牙所预测的。冰王从未让卡莉出去，因为她在他眼中被视为“缺陷”。她生来就是哑巴，是家里唯一的女孩，而家里其他都是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 象牙也是，以他们独特的方式。当象牙宣布自己是无性别时，世界似乎也改变了。他们被分配了那些大部分时间需要独处的工作，作为与众不同的一种惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们还被迫作为公主的仆人工作。不过，他们并不太介意，因为他们也交到了一个朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “你的生日快到了，对吧？”象牙问道，他记得公主的生日就在几天后。卡莉点了点头，她浅蓝色的眼睛里闪过一丝悲伤。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: “你想庆祝一下吗？”他们问，回想起她上次回答时的情景。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 不，卡莉放弃了。象牙知道那对她来说是个艰难的话题。那是她被关在房间里的日子，而她的母亲被驱逐了。象牙那时还只是个婴儿，但他们记得仆人和镇上的人们有多么愤怒。他们听说艾尔文女王是个好女王，但同时她也奇怪地预知了将要发生的事情。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: “那么……你想做什么？”他们问。卡莉抬头看着他们，兴奋得满脸通红。她递给象牙一张纸。然而，当他们低头看那张纸时……

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 0430 伊塔尼亚时间。科伦讨厌这么早起床。主要是因为他负责叫醒公司里的其他人。他悄悄地从铺位上下来，穿上战斗迷彩服，套上突击背心，从储物柜里收拾好自己的物品，特别小心地拿着一个小盒子。他把步枪扛在肩上，把头盔挂在腰带上的一个小钩子上。它配备了所有必要的装备，包括呼吸器、护目镜等。检查完弹匣后，他悄悄地走出了兵营，泥浆和冰块在他的靴子下发出嘎吱声。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从夹克口袋里拿出打火机，从另一个口袋里拿出香烟。点燃后，他吸了一口，然后稍微打开门。在过去的一周里，他不得不在唤醒他指挥下的男女时发挥创造力。他不再使用预设的闹钟，有一半时间它根本不起作用，从扬声器里传来的只是一阵轻微的嘶嘶声。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: “把他们叫醒”科伦转过身，看到中尉内米克走过来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 他还没来得及回答，门就开了，哈里斯、克雷思和其他几个人已经穿好衣服，装备齐全，匆忙走了出去。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，长官。他们应该已经在路上了，我们给了他们时间去食堂领取口粮。”  在0500准时，出埃及记连队在车库集合。肖走上一个箱子，开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: “我们正前往FOB I-131，距离伊恩洛斯五十英里。我们的任务是支援对伊恩洛斯的持续围攻和随后的进攻，以清除那里的叛乱分子。从那里，我们将建立立足点，并作为山区基地。”肖解释道。“带上你的小队，准备出发。”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 队伍分散开来，各自加入小队，他们的中士让他们爬上一辆坦克。科伦爬上了车队更前面的一辆坦克，加入了尼梅克、克雷思和两名新兵。科伦记得他们几天前刚来，但对他们了解不多。他坐在侧面，腿悬在车外，调整着他的背包和无线电设备，这些设备连接着他的耳塞和喉部麦克风。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: “嘿，Cohren，Harris还养着Snowball吗？”他们安顿下来后，Nemic问道。

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你是说他偷的那只鸡？”科伦想起了他们从农场偷走他的那天早上，“是的，我敢肯定。”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦瞥了一眼另一个坦克，发现了哈里斯和他的小队。从他的背包后面，他勉强可以看到一只小鸡在移动，四处张望，扫描着周围的环境。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: “是的，他还在那里。”科伦回答道，这时坦克的炮塔舱盖咔哒一声打开，指挥官露出了身影。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有坦克正在撤离。”指挥官平静而清晰地对着耳机说道。一排坦克和斯特赖克装甲车的引擎轰鸣着，开始向前移动。克罗诺斯·科伦号随着刹车的解除而震动，向前移动，进入队形。坦克在穿越伊塔尼亚平原时，采取了楔形队形。冬季风暴已经冻结了湿地和森林，但泥泞却始终存在。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 大约一个小时后，新兵之一，名叫奥森的科伦，开口说道：“中尉，你从战争开始就在这里，对吧？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: “是的，火风暴行动，”科伦回答，“我们以为几周内就能结束，但是……我们低估了他们。”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising. With our recent discovery of Ignniat, humanity has once skyrocketed past its peak; the greatest has yet to be achieved. This grace of newfound knowledge could only be described as divine intervention - we humanity will be able to grace the gods with our presence in their land in the clouds. Everyone within the company of Karascene has evaluated Ignniat and we sense a large potential within this mineral – worry not, Ignniat has not been evaluated to have any side effects or downsides of being mined, it has a higher chance to–
target: 人类的进步从不曾停止，即使在困难时期，我们也会再次成长和适应。城市像以前一样繁荣，我们的技术进步也在不断攀升。随着我们最近对Ignniat的发现，人类再次超越了巅峰；最伟大的成就还没有实现。这份新发现的恩赐只能被描述为神圣的干预——我们人类将能够以我们的存在荣耀神们在云中的土地。卡拉斯克公司的每个人都评估了Ignniat，我们感受到这个矿物中的巨大潜力——不用担心，Ignniat的评估结果显示它没有任何副作用或开采的缺点，它更有可能——

source: A click. It had been reruns of this same stream, the day the world was ruined. Dad always found himself turning the channel off when I was unable to tear my eyes away. The somber face he gave me ensured a gut-wrenching feeling transpiring from deep within – I always feel bad when it plays, but it opens the floodgates to so many memories; granted they weren't very good ones. Letting out a sigh, I slowly rose to my feet, gotta get my mind off things. His saddened mood remained, and regularly I’d try to help ease his mood and at least give him a little bit of joy, but today; I’m tired.
target: 一声点击。它一直是同一个流的重播，世界毁灭的那天。爸爸总是当我无法移开目光时关掉频道。他给我露出的一脸悲伤让我从深处感到撕心裂肺的感觉——我总是感到不好当它播放，但它打开了许多回忆的大门；虽然它们不是很好的回忆。叹了一口气，我慢慢站起来，得让我的脑子离开这些事情。他的悲伤情绪仍然存在，我经常尝试帮助缓和他的情绪，至少给他一点点的欢乐，但今天；我累了。

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.
target: 我以相对缓慢的步伐走近门口，对爸爸喊了一声。“我要出去一会儿，晚饭在冰箱里。”没有回应。算了。他通常能听到我的声音，他可能没事。慢慢地关上门，我又叹了一口气，当门完全关闭时。我几乎忘记了，把手放在冷冰冰的金属扫描器上锁上门。如果这公寓有什么，那就是先进的技术，不过；大多数地方都有显著的技术——已经很久没有人使用其他不同的技术了。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 寒冷、雨夜接着我的长期拖延的散步——探索帕尔特里克斯市对那些通过逃跑或纯粹运气避免了变异的人来说是一种特权。城市的夜晚很美丽，星星灿烂，已经持续了数千年。天空中的星星一定很孤独。帕尔特里克斯是一个不错的地方，但它感觉更像一个牢笼，而不是一个豪华的居住地。由于伊格尼亚特，几乎所有的建筑都是数百层高的，充满了公寓、家园和其他能容纳居民的建筑。这是一种使技术和建筑得以延伸生命基础的伟大矿物。然而，公众只知道这矿物的一些信息，因为它被严格保密。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 我摆脱了混乱的思绪，找到了一条通往我最喜欢的咖啡店的路；大多数人避免去那里，因为谣言传播说该地区发现了感染漏洞，即社会所说的病毒感染者。这从不真正困扰我，我一生中一直有着不可思议的好运，加上店主是一个非常好的人。谁会放弃免费的咖啡，来换取深夜的闲聊和谈话？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进去，一声响亮的铃声驱散了我的不适，新鲜煮咖啡的香气充满我的肺部。安东，店主，当然是柜台后面的那个人——店里几乎空无一人，只有几个人在后面。走近柜台，我的脚因长途跋涉而疲劳，我无力地趴在一个高脚凳上，打了一个哈欠。我看到安东端来常规的饮料。“嘿，莉莉丝，晚上很晚？”他的沙哑声音在我脑海中的碎片中回荡，“有点儿那样，”我疲惫地回答，变得越来越疲劳。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 准备好治愈我的疲劳，我喝了面前的咖啡几口。“自从那次目击事件后，生意还不景气吗？”我小声说，不想吓跑安顿单位剩下的顾客。他点头，用抹布擦拭玻璃——这里技术上是一家酒吧，但我从不真正来喝酒。从后面传来一些低语，但今晚我和安顿之间的对话保持得相当简短。向他挥手道别，我离开了店铺；比之前多了一点精力。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 深夜漫步在黑暗的街道上通常不是最好的选择，但老实说，比呆在那个狭小的公寓里要好；地狱，大多数时候你能听到邻居们做爱的声音比你能听到音乐的声音还要清楚。伴随着快速、急促的叹息，我将目光返回到前方的道路上——我可能会朝着阿尔的当铺走去；只是一个我找到有趣废品的地方，作为消遣。快速的悔恨涌上我的心头，因为我听到身后靠近的脚步声，也许我是在过度思考，但除非想被抢劫或殴打，否则不会有人在这个地方闲荡。这地方以其黑手党和帮派活动而出名……

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我悄悄地向店铺后面移动，听到金属栅栏后面的低语和谈话声，需要几下力气才能将其撕开。目前对我来说，爬入通风口是最安全和最安静的选择；爬行着，我会听到奇怪穿着的男人们之间的对话和谈话。我注意到阿尔在里面，被链锁着。果然他最终会被抓到的。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔博恩是一个好人，但这看起来很严重。不需要为了某个人伸出我的鼻子，特别是当他们似乎刚刚与城市中的每个权威机构闹翻时。然而，我仍然无法摆脱这种感觉。我无声地叹了口气，慢慢地从下面的格栅上消失，降落到安静的房间里。“嘘。阿尔。阿尔！”我低声喊叫，因为他没有回应。“莉莉丝？你在这里做什么？你必须离开，他会抓住你的。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 我默默地对自己说，不可能的。试图打开他胳膊上的锁链，周围的声音逼近我们的位置，隐隐的脚步声越来越响。“快！回到通风管里，离开，不要回来。如果我们再次相遇，不会是在这个城市。”他急促地说，脸上的恐慌一闪让我更加紧张。听从他的建议，我不能让自己再呆下去。该死的，阿尔。我快速跑开，离开通风管；失去这样一个无价的朋友真的很痛苦。他们是不是要把他转移到……另一个城市？我的脑子里闪过很多愤怒和悲伤的想法。我曾经对外围城市和感染之都阿尔卡特拉兹进行了许多研究——他们以监狱命名，感觉很适合从我读过的东西来看。更不用说未变异者已经切断了与感染土地的所有连接，这真是……悲惨的。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家的路程很安静，但却很吵闹。脑海中的想法在激荡，不帮助的悔恨感反复出现。我终于回到家中，几乎被来自云上的响雷和恐怖的步伐声所吓哭。爸爸已经躺在沙发上睡着了，可能是一部10-12年前的老电影；我叹了口气，悄悄地溜回自己的房间。扑倒在床上，我很快就无法保持睁眼的状态。不久，睡眠便爬上了我。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 天就这样过去了，我甚至没有意识到。阿尔博恩被带走已经有几天了——去哪里我不知道，但我知道他被带走了。那些制服看起来很熟悉，但我不可能第一时间就 figure出来。叹气，我把手放在我面前的系统上，发出红色和紫色的光芒——我可以 hack 安全系统，这地方不远，我怀疑他们没有采取措施……也许我不应该。当然，违背所有道德，我的手指不由自主地移动，拉起多个屏幕；天啊，我真的很厉害。我在几个网站上非常出名，他们称我为“幽灵”。这是一个非常吸引人的名字。当然，在任何网站上的名字都是WR417H，但我喜欢认为公众创造了它。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 我将监控转移到移动设备上，紧盯着每一个。什么也没有。就像他们从来没有出现过一样。这不合逻辑。摄像头的安全性很高，即使是远程访问也一样。怎么可能……ARGH。我愤怒地站起来，准备把一些想法从头脑中清除掉——我穿上鞋子，拿起钥匙。“我很快就会回来的，爸爸。”沉默。无所谓，他通常不回应，他可能正在忙着比我更重要的事情。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 突然一阵颤抖，我感到一股寒意顺着脊椎向下流淌，当我离开公寓时；很奇怪。无视这种感觉，我催促自己前往Al的店铺调查一下，但是我的腿却朝着安顿的小酒吧移动──那里是一个相当平静的地方，我绝对需要与某人谈谈。谁比一个欠你情的酒保更合适？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 不规律地，安顿的店挺忙的；店里充满了活动和我从未见过的新面孔——安顿通常是唯一的工人，所以我知道他一定很压力。“嘿，酒保，给我一杯咖啡。”我故意以较低的音调说话，想让他有点措手不及，一丝微笑从我嘴角溜出，看到他快速转身后的松一口气。“天哪，莉莉丝，不要这样对我…”他轻轻地说，明显很疲惫。“你看起来挺忙的……你需要一些帮助？看起来这里有很多人。”我叹了口气，我不想帮助这些醉鬼，但我感到不好让这个家伙一个人在这里工作。“你能吗？我会后付你…”他以小狗般的眼睛看着我，目光直视着我。高级战争策略……

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 塔萨林的嘴巴中突然喷出一团火焰，当这巨大的特拉基人点燃了一块非常特定的森林，然后在上空盘旋，观看了一刻。奇怪的是，当他减速时，他背后那奇怪的尖叫声停止了。塔萨林忘记了他背上有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我的飞行非常不同于被巨大的粉红色龙突然拖走！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯尔显然不同意尼西，他看起来不那么黑了，爪子已经深入塔萨林的背部，足以使得塔拉基人流血，但塔萨林显然并不在乎。话说回来，塔萨林意识到他吓到了新朋友，于是找到了一个空旷的地方降落。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: 「我道歉，但是我捕捉到了气息。我不得不处理它！」

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你一定要拖我们一起吗？”特努克爬下塔萨林的背部，滑下他的尾巴，同时咔嚓着说。“我们还把雷特维克留下了！我们抛弃了我们的强壮、战斗的家伙！他怎么能找到我们？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: “他会搞定的…”尼西嘟囔道。“雷特维克行动慢，但他并不傻。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: 尼西眨眼，转回头对特努克说：“当然他能开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，明显不是。那生物只是发出嘶鸣声，试图直接飞向塔萨林。幸好，尽管他很大，塔萨林足够敏捷，能够躲开，但尼西无法控制自己尖叫，因为她几乎失去了对塔萨林光滑鳞片的握持。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: 塔萨林发出嘶鸣声，然后绕圈靠近他称之为家园的山。黑兽跟随着，但当一股火焰从背后袭击它时，它变得有些惊慌。生物没有意识到自己不再是独自一人。随着塔萨林放慢速度，然后用尾巴猛击黑兽的头侧，将其击偏，黑兽变得更加惊慌。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 嗥叫着、嘶鸣着，那生物飞向上方，向空中喷吐。everything 突然变暗，就像怪物正在从天空本身吸收光芒，代之以一个永恒的黑夜云团。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 塔萨林不再能看到，试图撤退，但发现自己刮擦到了树林顶部，然后冲进一个空地。那生物似乎知道塔萨林倒下的确切位置，径直朝他走去，带着黑云一起。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: “凯尔！”特努克叫喊着，从云中滑出，开始盘旋，试图在下面的黑暗中找到尼西和萨萨林。“我们该怎么办？凯尔。。。凯尔，你在哪里？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: 下面，尼西拼命爬起来。她相当确定自己断了一些东西，但是她奇怪的、非自然的愈合能力已经启动了。同样的情况不能用于塔萨林，他躺在一堆，靠着唯一没有被他体重压垮的树。尼西尽力尝试去够塔萨林，但是她几乎看不到前面两米以外的一切。一切都是漆黑的，被不洁的阴影所吞没。在这些阴影中，有什么东西正在尖叫和嚎叫。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 一条可怕的、 club状的尾巴摔倒在地上，靠近尼西，撞倒了她。她注意到，虽然尾巴在乱甩，但不是针对她。那生物，尼西所能看到和听到的一切，是在嘶吼和撕扯它创造的阴影。某物正在通过黑暗传送，刺向怪物，迷惑它。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: “请！”埃尔温王后恳求道，“不要把她赶走！她只是一个孩子！”冰王从他的王座上看着他的妻子，他的皇家顾问站在他旁边。她生了一个女孩。他皱眉思考这个念头。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 那个女孩看起来很像她的母亲；淡蓝色的眼睛和白色的头发，带有蓝色的丝线。冰王认为有一个女儿使他看起来软弱。毕竟，到目前为止，他只有儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: “你只有两个选择，要么杀死孩子，要么将其送入荒野。这是你错误的惩罚，埃尔温。”他吐出她的名字，仿佛它是毒药。他总是这样做。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 弗罗斯费尔并不总是一個王國。它曾被分裂為二，北方和南方。在北方，沒有魔法的王國。在南方，一個充滿幻想力量展示的王國。由於北方的貪婪，兩個王國陷入了一場無休止的戰爭，直到南方提出停戰協議。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方绝望了，他们的王室愿意做任何事来停止流血。他们将唯一的公主献给北方，作为北方的女王，并生下一个儿子作为未来的国王。然后，南方将与北方合并，成为一个王国。北方接受了，公主埃尔温嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: “我恳求您，我的国王，为我的孩子的安全，请随意处置我，关押我，流放我，或者杀死我。”埃尔温王后紧紧抱着孩子，恳求道。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王低头看着他的王后，眼睛里满是厌恶。也许，只是也许，他会对她仁慈。那位与他一起度过二十二年的女人，那位总是在他最低谷时关心他的女人，那位为他生下儿子的女人。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: “很好。孩子可以住在宫殿里。”他说，引得女王叹了一口气。“但是，”他添加道，“你将被处决。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和埃尔温女王本人都露出恐惧的表情。她慢慢地低头看着地板。“是的，我的国王。”她鞠躬。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
target: 她翻到一页空白页，并在上面写下日期。在下面，她写道，“648年5月11日-648年12月13日。”

source: “Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “回忆旧时光？”象牙询问，望着旧笔记本。卡瑞点头。“你认为他们会在圣诞节让你出狱吗？离圣诞节只剩几天了。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡里在灯笼上敲了两下。不，如象牙预测的那样。冰王从不让卡里出去，因为在他眼中她被视为“一个缺陷”。她生来就是哑巴，是家中唯一的女孩，因为家中都是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 象牙也是，以他们自己的特殊方式。当象牙宣布自己为非二元性别时，似乎整个世界也改变了。他们被安排了大部分时间需要独自工作的任务，作为不同之处的惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们也被迫担任公主的仆人。不过他们并不太介意，因为他们也获得了一个朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “你的生日快到了，不是吗？”象牙问道，记得公主的生日就在几天后。卡里点头，眼中闪烁着悲伤的光芒。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: “你想庆祝吗？” 他们问道，回忆她上次回答这个问题的情景。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 卡丽放弃了。象牙知道这对她是一个艰难的话题。这是她被关在房间里，她母亲被流放的那天。象牙当时还是一个婴儿，但他们记得仆人和镇民们的愤怒。他们听说埃尔温女王是一个好女王，但也奇怪地预测了将要发生的事情。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: “那么……你想做什么？”他们问。卡里看着他们，充满激动。她递给아이보리一张纸。当他们低头看它时……

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 0430意大利亚时间。科伦恨早起。他主要是因为他需要负责叫醒他公司里的所有人。无声地从他的床铺上出来，他穿上战斗制服，披上突击背心，从他的储物柜中收拾自己的行李，小心地处理一个特别的小盒。他肩负着步枪，并将头盔挂在他的腰带上连接的一个小钩子上。它配备了所有的固定装置，呼吸器，护目镜，一切所需的东西。在检查了他的弹药袋后，他静静地走出兵营，泥浆和冰块在他的靴子下嘎吱作响。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从夹克口袋里拿出打火机，从另一个口袋里拿出香烟。点燃后，他吸了一小口，然后打开门稍微一点。在过去的一周里，他不得不在叫醒他手下的男女士兵时变得很有创意。他停止使用预设的闹钟，半数时间它根本不起作用，只从扬声器里发出轻微的嘶鸣声。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: “唤醒他们”科伦转身看到尼米克中尉走过来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 他还没来得及回答，门就打开了，哈里斯、克雷斯和其他几个人已经穿戴整齐、装备齐全地冲了出来。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，长官，现在他们应该已经在路上了，我们让他们从食堂拿了补给”  正好在0500，出埃及公司在机动池集合。肖步上了箱子开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: “我们正在搬迁到FOB I-131，位于Ianlos外五十英里的地方。我们的任务是支持Ianlos的围困和后续攻击，以驱逐当地的叛乱分子。”肖解释道。“和你的小队会合，准备出发”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 公司散开，分成小队，每个小队由一名军士长率领，命令他们登上坦克之一。科伦爬上车队中的一辆坦克，与内米克、克雷斯和两个新兵一起。科伦记得他们几天前刚刚抵达，但对他们不太了解。坐在坦克侧边，腿悬空，他调整了背包和无线电设备，这些设备连接到耳机和喉咙麦克风。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: “嘿科伦，哈里斯还拥有雪球吗？”尼米克问道，当他们安顿下来时。

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你是说他偷的鸡吗？”科伦回忆起他们从农场偷他那天早上的事。“yeah，我相当确定”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦瞥向另一个坦克，看到了哈里斯和他的小队。从背包后面，他刚好能看到一只小鸡移动着头，扫描周围的情况。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: “嗯，他还拥有它”科伦回答道，坦克炮塔的舱盖打开，指挥官出现在视野中。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有坦克正在驶出” 指挥官冷静但清晰地对着他的耳机说道。 一排坦克和斯特赖克尔的引擎轰鸣着启动，开始向前推进。 克罗诺斯·科伦坦克的刹车释放，向前移动，排入队形。 坦克们以楔形队形驶过伊塔尼亚平原。 冬季风暴已经冻结了湿地和森林，但泥泞总是存在。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 大约一个小时后，新兵之一科伦记起自己的名字是奥森，开口说道：“中尉，你从战争开始就一直在这里，对吧？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: “嗯，火storm行动”，科伦回答道。“我们以为几周内就结束了，但是……我们低估了他们”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising. With our recent discovery of Ignniat, humanity has once skyrocketed past its peak; the greatest has yet to be achieved. This grace of newfound knowledge could only be described as divine intervention - we humanity will be able to grace the gods with our presence in their land in the clouds. Everyone within the company of Karascene has evaluated Ignniat and we sense a large potential within this mineral – worry not, Ignniat has not been evaluated to have any side effects or downsides of being mined, it has a higher chance to–
target: 人类的进步从未停止过，哪怕是一刻——在困难时期，我们再次成长和适应。城市一如既往地繁荣，我们的技术进步也在不断提升。随着我们最近发现 Ignniat，人类一度飞速发展，超越了巅峰；最伟大的成就尚未实现。这种新发现知识的恩惠只能被描述为神的干预——我们人类将能够以我们在云端土地上的存在来恩惠众神。Karascene 公司的每个人都对 Ignniat 进行了评估，我们感觉到这种矿物具有巨大的潜力——不用担心，Ignniat 尚未被评估为开采后会产生任何副作用或不利影响，它更有可能——

source: A click. It had been reruns of this same stream, the day the world was ruined. Dad always found himself turning the channel off when I was unable to tear my eyes away. The somber face he gave me ensured a gut-wrenching feeling transpiring from deep within – I always feel bad when it plays, but it opens the floodgates to so many memories; granted they weren't very good ones. Letting out a sigh, I slowly rose to my feet, gotta get my mind off things. His saddened mood remained, and regularly I’d try to help ease his mood and at least give him a little bit of joy, but today; I’m tired.
target: 咔嚓一声。这是同一频道的重播，世界毁灭的那一天。每当我移不开目光时，爸爸总会关掉频道。他那阴沉的脸让我内心深处感到一阵痛彻心扉——每当它播放时我都感到难过，但它打开了通往许多回忆的闸门；当然，它们并不是很好。我叹了口气，慢慢站起来，必须把心思放开。他的悲伤情绪依然存在，我经常试图帮助他缓解情绪，至少给他一点快乐，但今天，我累了。

source: I hold a relatively slow pace as I approach the door, giving a small holler to Dad. “I’ll be heading out for a bit, dinner is in the fridge.” No response. Figures. He usually hears me though, he’ll probably be fine. Slowly closing the door behind me, I let another breathy sigh escape as the door completely shut. Nearly forgetting, I place my hand on the cold, metallic scanner that locks the door. If there was anything this apartment had, it was advanced tech, but then again; most places had notable technology–it had been a long time since anyone had used any other different technology.
target: 我慢慢地走向门口，对爸爸轻声叫了一声。“我要出去一会儿，晚餐在冰箱里。”没有回应。真是的。不过他通常能听到我的声音，他应该没事。我慢慢关上身后的门，门完全关上时，我又叹了一口气。我差点忘了，把手放在锁门的冰冷的金属扫描仪上。如果这间公寓有什么的话，那就是先进的技术，但话又说回来，大多数地方都有值得注意的技术——已经很久没有人使用过其他不同的技术了。

source: The cold, rainy night ensued my long overdue walk–exploring the city of Paltricus was a privilege to those who’d been safe from the mutation via escape, or pure luck. The city night was beautiful, illuminated with vibrant stars that remained for thousands of years. It must be lonely in the great distant sky. Paltricus was a nice place, but it felt more like a cage than a luxurious place of living. Filled to the brim with apartments, homes, and any other building able to hold occupants, most buildings were hundreds of stories tall; thanks to Ignniat. The mineral that appeased technology, and architecture was a great mineral that extended our foundation of life. Public knowledge only knows so much about this mineral though, mainly because mainly because it’s kept under pretty tough wraps.
target: 寒冷的雨夜接踵而至，我终于踏上了姗姗来迟的徒步之旅——探索帕尔特里库斯城是那些通过逃生或纯粹的运气而免受变异之害的人的特权。这座城市的夜晚很美，被数千年来一直存在的璀璨星光照亮。它在遥远的天空中一定很孤独。帕尔特里库斯是个不错的地方，但它更像是一个笼子，而不是一个豪华的居住场所。这里挤满了公寓、住宅和其他任何能容纳居住者的建筑，大多数建筑都有几百层楼高；这要归功于伊格尼亚特。这种安抚科技和建筑的矿物是一种伟大的矿物，它延伸了我们的生活基础。然而，公众对这种矿物的了解有限，主要是因为它被严格保密。

source: Removing myself from clouded thoughts, I found my way to my favorite coffee spot; most people avoid it because rumors were spread that a lapse was found in the area, which was what society has referred to those whom the virus has infected. This never really disturbed me, I’ve had incredible luck my entire life, plus the owner is a great guy. Who would pass up free coffee in exchange for talks and chats late at night?
target: 摆脱了纷乱的思绪，我找到了自己最喜欢的咖啡店；大多数人都避开它，因为有传言说该地区发现了漏洞，这是社会对那些被病毒感染的人的称呼。这从未真正困扰过我，我一生都很幸运，而且店主是个好人。谁会放弃免费咖啡来换取深夜的谈话和聊天呢？

source: Walking inside, a loud ring dispelled my discomfort as the aroma of freshly brewed coffee filled my lungs. Anton, the man who owned the store, was of course the person behind the counter – the place was practically empty except for a few people in the back. Approaching the counter, my feet tired from a long walk, I droop atop one of the stools and yawn. I spot Anton bringing the regular thankfully. “Hey Lilith, Long night?” his raspy voice echoed within the fractals of my brain, “Something of the sort,” I replied shallowly, more tired and tired by the second.
target: 走进店内，一阵响亮的铃声驱散了我的不适，新鲜煮好的咖啡的香气弥漫在我的肺部。店主安东当然是柜台后面的人——除了后面的几个人，店里几乎空无一人。走近柜台，我的脚因为长途跋涉而疲惫不堪，我瘫坐在一张凳子上打哈欠。我感激地看到安东端着常客的饮料。“嘿，莉莉丝，长夜漫漫？”他沙哑的声音在我大脑的碎片中回荡，“差不多吧，”我浅浅地回答道，一秒钟比一秒钟更累。

source: Ready to fix my fatigue, I took a few sips of the coffee placed in front of me. “Business still down since that sighting..?” I spoke quietly, not attempting to scare away the remaining customers that Anton’s unit had. He nodded, cleaning a glass with a rag – this place is technically a bar, but I never really came for drinks. A few murmurs could be heard from behind, but for the most part, the conversation between me and Anton was held rather short tonight. Waving him a small goodbye, I left the shop; with a little more energy than before.
target: 为了消除疲劳，我喝了几口摆在面前的咖啡。“自从那次目击事件之后，生意还不好吗？”我轻声说道，不想吓跑安东店里剩下的顾客。他点点头，用抹布擦着玻璃杯——这个地方严格来说是酒吧，但我并不是真的来喝酒的。可以听到身后传来几声低语，但总的来说，今晚我和安东之间的谈话相当简短。我向他挥手告别，离开了商店；比以前精力充沛了一点。

source: Wandering the dark streets late at night wasn’t usually the best option, but honestly, it was better than staying in that stuffy apartment; hell most of the time you could hear the neighbors having sex more than you could hear your music. With a quick, breathy sigh, I returned my gaze to the walk ahead–I’ll probably make my way towards Al’s Pawnshop; just a place I find junk that looks interesting, as a pastime. Quick regret flushed over me as I heard footsteps close behind, maybe I'm overthinking it, but nobody hung around this place unless they wanted to get mugged, or beaten up. It was popular for its mafia and gang activities…
target: 深夜在黑暗的街道上徘徊通常不是最好的选择，但老实说，这比呆在闷热的公寓里要好；大多数时候，你能听到邻居做爱的声音比你能听到的音乐还要多。我气喘吁吁地叹了口气，把目光转回前面——我可能会朝艾尔当铺走去；这只是一个我找到看起来很有趣的垃圾的地方，作为一种消遣。当我听到身后传来的脚步声时，我立刻感到后悔，也许我想太多了，但没有人会在这个地方闲逛，除非他们想被抢劫或殴打。它以黑手党和帮派活动而闻名……

source: Stealthily I made my way towards the back of the store, murmurs and talking heard beyond a metal grate which took a few yanks to tear off. Climbing into the vent was the safest and quietest option for me right now; climbing my way through, I’d pick up on conversations and talks between strangely dressed men. I noticed Al inside, chained. Figures he’d get caught eventually.
target: 我偷偷地走向商店后面，金属栅栏后面传来低语和谈话声，栅栏需要用力拉几下才能扯下来。爬进通风口对我来说是目前最安全、最安静的选择；爬过去，我会听到穿着奇怪的男人之间的对话和谈话。我注意到阿尔在里面，被锁链锁着。我想他最终会被抓住的。

source: Alborn was a great guy, but this looked serious. No need to stick my nose out for someone, especially when they seem like they’ve just gotten into trouble with every authority in the city. Yet, I still couldn’t shake the feeling. Letting a silent sigh escape me, I slowly warped off the grate below, dropping down into the quiet room. “Psst. Al. Al!” I whispered, giving a soft yell at his lack of response. “Lilith? What are you doing here..? You’ve gotta leave, he’ll catch you.”
target: 阿尔本是个好人，但事情看起来很严重。没必要为某人多管闲事，尤其是当他们似乎刚刚与城里的所有当局发生冲突时。然而，我仍然无法摆脱这种感觉。我默默叹了口气，慢慢地从下面的格栅上爬下来，落进安静的房间里。“嘘。阿尔。阿尔！”我低声说，对他没有回应轻声叫了一声。“莉莉丝？你在这里干什么……？你必须离开，他会抓你的。”

source: No shit, I silently voiced to myself. Attempting to lockpick the chains that wrapped around his arms, voices closed in on our location, the faint footsteps growing ever louder. “Quick! Get back in the vent, and leave. Do not come back. If we meet again, it won’t be in this city.” He said hurriedly, the flash of panic on his face didn’t help my nerves at all. Listening to his advice. I couldn’t bring myself to stay longer. Fuck, Al. I quickly ran for it after exiting the vent; it hurt a bit to lose such an invaluable friend. Were they moving him to the…other city? So many things were flicking through my slightly scattered mind, and most of them were angry but sad. I’d done numerous kinds of research on the outer cities, and the capital of the infected, Alcatraz, which they named after the prison – felt like it fit the name pretty well from what I’d read. Not to mention the unmutated had cut any remaining connecting land with infected land, it was…tragic.
target: 别胡扯，我默默地对自己说。我试图撬开缠在他手臂上的锁链，声音越来越近，微弱的脚步声越来越大。“快！回到通风口，离开。不要回来。如果我们再见面，不会在这座城市。”他急忙说道，脸上闪过一丝恐慌，对我的紧张情绪毫无帮助。听了他的建议。我再也忍不住要呆下去了。操，阿尔。我离开通风口后迅速逃跑了；失去这样一位宝贵的朋友让我有点难过。他们要把他转移到……另一个城市吗？我有点散乱的脑海里闪过很多事情，其中大部分都是愤怒而悲伤的。我对外围城市和感染者的首都恶魔岛做了无数研究，他们以监狱的名字命名——从我读到的内容来看，我觉得它很符合这个名字。更不用说未变异者已经切断了与感染土地的任何剩余连接土地，这真是……悲惨。

source: The walk home was quiet, but so loud. The thoughts infecting my brain were booming, and the regret of not having stayed to help flashed over multiple times. I finally arrived home, almost brought to tears by the dreadful walk in the burst of sounds from the clouds above, the thunderous booms were enough to frighten any person sometimes. Dad was already passed out on the couch, some rerun of an older movie, probably 10-12 years old; sighing, I quietly crept my way back to my room. Flopping in the bed, I wasn’t able to keep my eyes open for long. Before long, slumber crept up on me.
target: 回家的路上很安静，但又很吵闹。我脑子里的想法不断涌现，后悔没有留下来帮忙的想法多次闪过。我终于回到了家，在云层上方爆发的声音中，我几乎被这段可怕的旅程吓哭了，有时雷鸣般的轰鸣足以吓坏任何人。爸爸已经在沙发上睡着了，他正在重播一部大概 10-12 年前的老电影；我叹了口气，悄悄地爬回房间。我扑通一声倒在床上，眼睛睁不开。不久，睡意就悄悄袭来。

source: The days rolled past before I could even realize it. It was a few days since Alborn was taken away – to where I had no clue, but I knew he was taken somewhere. Those outfits seemed familiar, but no way was I going to figure it out on the first try. Sighing, I placed my hands on the system in front of me, emanating a red and purple glow – I could hack the security, the place isn’t far, and I doubt they took measures...Maybe I shouldn’t. Of course, against all morals, my fingers moved without my knowing, pulling up multiple screens; god I’m good. I was pretty popular on a couple of websites, they referred to me as “WRAITH.” Which was a pretty catchy name. Granted my name on any site is WR417H, but I like to think the public came up with it.
target: 日子一天天过去，我甚至还没意识到。几天前，阿尔本被带走了——我不知道他被带到了哪里，但我知道他被带到了某个地方。那些衣服看起来很熟悉，但我不可能第一次就猜出来。我叹了口气，把手放在我面前的系统上，发出红紫色的光芒——我可以破解安全系统，那个地方不远，我怀疑他们有没有采取措施……也许我不应该。当然，违背道德，我的手指在不知情的情况下移动，拉出多个屏幕；天哪，我真厉害。我在几个网站上很受欢迎，他们称我为“幽灵”。这是一个很吸引人的名字。当然，我在任何网站上的名字都是 WR417H，但我喜欢认为这是公众想出来的。

source: Moving the surveillance onto my mobile device, I watched each one intently. Nothing. It was like they were never there. That makes no sense. Cameras had tight security, even with remote access. How..? ARGH. I stood angrily, ready to remove some thoughts from my head – I made my way over, sliding on shoes and taking my keys. “I’ll be back soon, Dad.”Silence. Whatever, he didn’t usually respond, he was probably busy doing something more important than me anyway.
target: 我把监控移到移动设备上，仔细观察每一个。什么都没有。就好像他们从来没有出现过一样。这没有道理。摄像头的安保措施很严密，即使是远程访问。怎么可能……？啊。我生气地站着，准备把一些想法从脑子里赶走——我走了过去，穿上鞋子，拿上钥匙。“我很快就会回来的，爸爸。”沉默。不管怎样，他通常不会回应，反正他可能在忙着做一些比我更重要的事情。

source: With a quick jolt, I felt a shiver enthrall its way down my spine as I made my way out of the apartment; weird. Ignoring the feeling, I urged myself to head towards Al’s to investigate a little, but my legs moved towards Anton’s small bar – it was a pretty calm place, and I definitely needed to talk to someone. Who better than a bartender who owes you something?
target: 突然，我感到一阵颤抖，走出公寓时，我的脊柱一阵发凉；很奇怪。我无视这种感觉，催促自己去 Al's 看看，但我的双腿却朝着 Anton 的小酒吧走去——那是一个非常安静的地方，我绝对需要找个人谈谈。还有谁比一个欠你什么的调酒师更合适呢？

source: Irregularly, Anton’s was pretty busy; it was bustling with activity and new faces that I’ve never seen before – Anton was regularly the only worker, so knowing that he must be pretty stressed. “Hey Barkeep, get me a coffee.” I purposely spoke in a lower tone to throw him off a bit, a small chuckle escaping me seeing his sigh of relief after turning quickly. “God, Lilith, don’t do that to me…” he softly let out, obviously tired. “You seem pretty busy…you need some help? Look’s like there's more than plenty of folks here.” I huffed out, I do not want to help with these drunks, but I feel bad making this guy work alone out here. “Could you? I’ll pay you after…” he uttered with the eyes of a puppy, aimed straight at me. Advanced War Tactics…
target: 安东的酒吧偶尔会很忙；这里熙熙攘攘，到处都是我从未见过的新面孔——安东经常是唯一的工作人员，所以我知道他一定很紧张。“嘿，酒保，给我拿杯咖啡。”我故意压低声音说，让他有点不知所措，看到他转过身后松了一口气，我不禁轻笑一声。“天哪，莉莉丝，别这样对我……”他轻声说道，显然很累。“你看起来很忙……你需要帮忙吗？看起来这里的人很多。”我气呼呼地说，我不想帮这些醉汉，但让这个家伙一个人在这里工作我觉得不好意思。“可以吗？我等会再付钱给你……”他像小狗一样盯着我说道。高级战争战术……

source: A burst of flames erupted from Thassalin's jaws as the colossal Thraki set fire to a very specific patch of forest, then circled above, watching for moment. Weirdly, as he had slowed down, the weird screaming noise from behind him had stopped. Thassalin had forgotten he had passengers on his back.
target: 巨大的色雷斯龙在一片特殊的森林中放火，一股火焰从萨萨林的嘴里喷涌而出，然后在上方盘旋，观察着一切。奇怪的是，当他减速时，身后奇怪的尖叫声也停止了。萨萨林忘记了背上还有乘客。

source: "My own flight is very different from being abruptly dragged off by a massive, pink dragon!"
target: “我自己的飞行与被一条巨大的粉红色龙突然拖走是非常不同的！”

source: Kayel clearly didn't agree with Nyssi, he looked less black than normal and his claws had dug into Thassalin's back to the point that he'd made the Thraki bleed, but Thassalin clearly didn't seem to care. That being said, Thassalin had realized he had scared his new friends and found a clearing to land in.
target: 凯耶尔显然不同意尼西的观点，他看起来没有平时那么黑，他的爪子已经深深地扎进了萨林的背上，甚至让色雷斯人流血不止，但萨林似乎并不在意。话虽如此，萨林意识到自己吓坏了他的新朋友，于是找到了一片空地降落。

source: "I APOLOGIZE BUT I PICKED UP A SCENT. I HAD TO DEAL WITH IT!"
target: “我很抱歉，但我闻到了气味。我必须处理它！”

source: "Did you have to drag us along as well?" Tenuk snapped as he climbed off Thassalin's back, sliding down his tail. "And we left Retvik behind! We abandoned our big, strong, fighty guy! How is he going to get to us?"
target: “你还得把我们拖走？”特努克一边从萨萨林背上爬下来，一边咆哮道，顺着他的尾巴滑下去。“我们把瑞特维克丢在后面了！我们抛弃了我们这个强壮、好斗的家伙！他要怎么来找我们？”

source: "He'll work it out..." Nyssi tutted. "Retvik's slow but he's not stupid."
target: “他会解决的……”尼西啧啧称奇。“雷特维克虽然慢，但他并不笨。”

source: Nyssi blinked and turned back to Tenuk. "Of course he can drive."
target: 尼西眨眨眼，转身对特努克说：“他当然会开车。”

source: No, clearly not. The creature just hissed and tried to fly directly into Thassalin. Thankfully, despite his size, Thassalin was nimble enough to get out of the way, but Nyssi couldn't help but scream as she very nearly lost her grip on Thassalin's overly smooth scales.
target: 不，显然不是。这个生物只是发出嘶嘶声，试图直接飞向 Thassalin。值得庆幸的是，尽管 Thassalin 体型庞大，但他足够敏捷，能够躲开，但 Nyssi 忍不住尖叫起来，因为她几乎抓不住 Thassalin 过于光滑的鳞片。

source: Thassalin hissed, then circled round, closer to the mountain he called home. The dark beast followed, but somewhat panicked as a blast of fire hit it from behind. The creature hadn't realised it was no longer alone. It panicked further as Thassalin slowed down then thwacked his tail into the side of the beast's head, knocking it off course.
target: 萨萨林发出嘶嘶声，然后绕了一圈，靠近他称之为家的那座山。黑暗野兽紧随其后，但当一股火焰从后面袭来时，它有些惊慌。这只生物没有意识到它不再孤身一人。当萨萨林放慢速度，然后用尾巴猛击野兽的头部一侧，将其击偏时，它更加惊慌失措。

source: Snarling and hissing, the creature flew upwards, spitting into the air. Everything suddenly went dark, as if the monster was sucking the light from the sky itself, replacing it with a cloud of perpetual night.
target: 那怪物一边咆哮，一边嘶嘶作响，飞向空中，向空中吐出一口唾沫。突然间，一切变得漆黑，仿佛那怪物正在吸干天空中的光亮，取而代之的是一片永恒的黑夜之云。

source: No longer able to see, Thassalin tried to retreat, but found himself scraping against the top of the treeline, before crashing into a clearing. The creature seemed to know exactly where Thassalin had fallen and headed straight for him, taking the dark cloud with it.
target: 萨萨林再也看不见东西了，他试图撤退，但发现自己撞到了树顶，然后撞到了一片空地。那只生物似乎知道萨萨林摔倒的确切位置，径直朝他冲过来，带着乌云一起。

source: "Kayel!" Tenuk exclaimed as he glided out of the cloud and began circling, trying to spot Nyssi and Thassalin in the darkness below. "What do we do? Kayel..? Kayel, where are you?"
target: “凯耶尔！”特努克一边大叫，一边滑出云层，开始盘旋，试图在下面的黑暗中发现尼西和萨萨林。“我们该怎么办？凯耶尔……？凯耶尔，你在哪里？”

source: Below, Nyssi scrambled to her feet. She was pretty sure she had broken something, but her weird, unnatural healing powers had already kicked in. The same couldn't have been said for Thassalin, who was lying in a lump, resting against the one tree that hadn't collapsed under his weight. Nyssi did her best to try and reach Thassalin but she could barely see more than a couple of meters in front of her. Everything was pitch black and engulfed in unholy shadows. And in said shadows, something was screaming and screeching.
target: 在下面，妮西挣扎着站了起来。她很确定自己弄断了什么东西，但她那怪异、不自然的治愈能力已经开始发挥作用。但塔萨林却不是这样，他正一瘸一拐地躺在地上，靠着唯一一棵没有被他的重量压倒的树。妮西竭尽全力试图靠近塔萨林，但她几乎看不到前方几米以外的地方。一切都是漆黑一片，被邪恶的阴影吞没。而在阴影中，有什么东西在尖叫和尖叫。

source: A horrible, clubbed tail smashed into the ground near Nyssi, knocking her over. She noticed though that the tail was flailing, not aiming at her. The creature, what little Nyssi could see and hear of it, was snarling and clawing at the shadows it had created. Something was teleporting through the darkness, stabbing at the monster, confusing it.
target: 一条可怕的棍状尾巴砸在 Nyssi 附近的地面上，把她打倒在地。不过她注意到那条尾巴是在挥舞，而不是瞄准她。小小的 Nyssi 能看到和听到的那个生物正在咆哮，并抓挠着它制造的阴影。有什么东西在黑暗中穿梭，刺向怪物，使它感到困惑。

source: “Please!” Queen Eirwen begged, “don’t send her away! She’s just a child!” The Ice King looked down at his wife from his throne, his royal advisor next to him. She had given birth to a girl. He scowled at the thought.
target: “求求你！”艾尔文王后恳求道，“别把她送走！她只是个孩子！”冰王坐在王座上，低头看着他的妻子，他的皇家顾问就坐在他身边。她生了一个女孩。想到这里，他皱起了眉头。

source: The girl in question looked a lot like her mother; pale blue eyes and white hair decorated with blue strands. The Ice King thought a daughter made him look weak. After all, he had only had sons up until this point.
target: 这位女孩看起来很像她的母亲，有着淡蓝色的眼睛和白色的头发，上面点缀着蓝色的发丝。冰王认为女儿让他显得软弱。毕竟，到目前为止，他只有儿子。

source: “The only options you have are to kill the child or send it out to the wilderness. This is her punishment for your wrongdoing, Eirwen .” He spat out her name as if it was poison. He always did.
target: “你唯一的选择就是杀死这个孩子，或者把她送到荒野。这是对你的不法行为的惩罚，艾尔文。”他吐出她的名字，仿佛那是毒药。他总是这样。

source: Frostfell was not always one kingdom. It was split in two, the North and the South. In the North, the non magical kingdom. To the South, a kingdom full of fantastical displays of power. Due to the North’s greed, the two kingdoms clashed in a never ending war, until the South offered a truce.
target: 弗罗斯特菲尔并不总是一个王国。它被分成了两个王国，南北两部分。北边是一个没有魔法的王国。南边是一个充满奇幻力量的王国。由于北边的贪婪，两个王国之间爆发了永无休止的战争，直到南边提出休战。

source: The South was desperate, and their royal family would do anything to stop the bloodshed. They offered their only princess to be queen of the North and bear a son to be the future king. Then, the South would join with the North to make one kingdom. The North accepted, and Princess Eirwen married Prince Akull.
target: 南方陷入了绝望，他们的王室愿意做任何事情来阻止流血事件。他们提出让唯一的公主成为北方的女王，并生下一个儿子作为未来的国王。然后，南方将与北方联合成为一个王国。北方接受了，艾尔文公主嫁给了阿库尔王子。

source: “I beg you, my king, in return for the safety of my child, do whatever you want to me, lock me up, banish me, or even kill me.” Queen Eirwen pleaded, holding her child tightly in her arms.
target: “国王大人，我恳求您，为了我孩子的安全，您可以对我做任何您想做的事，把我关起来，放逐我，甚至杀了我。”艾尔文王后紧紧地抱着孩子恳求道。

source: The Ice King looked down at his queen, disgust from his eyes. Maybe, just maybe, he would have mercy on her. The woman who he had been with for twenty-two years, the one who always cared for him at his lowest times, the one who had given birth to his sons.
target: 冰王低头看着他的女王，眼中满是厌恶。也许，只是也许，他会怜悯她。这个女人陪伴了他二十二年，在他最失意的时候总是照顾他，为他生下了儿子。

source: “Very well. The child may live in the palace.” He started, earning a sigh from the queen. “But,” he added. “You will be executed.”
target: “好吧。孩子可以住在宫殿里。”他开口道，引得女王叹了口气。“但是，”他补充道。“你会被处死。”

source: A shared look of horror came from the advisor and Queen Eirwen herself. She slowly looked down at the floor. “Yes, my king.” She bowed.
target: 顾问和艾尔文王后都露出了惊恐的表情。她慢慢地低下头看着地板。“是的，国王陛下。”她鞠躬行礼。

source: She flipped to a blank page and wrote the date on it. Under it, she wrote, “5/11/648 -12/13/648.”
target: 她翻到一张空白页，在上面写下日期。在日期下面，她写道：“5/11/648 -12/13/648。”

source: “Reviewing old memories?” Ivory inquired, looking at the old notebook. Kari nodded. “Do you think that they will let you out for Christmas? It’s only a few days away.”
target: “回顾旧记忆？”艾沃里看着旧笔记本问道。卡莉点点头。“你觉得他们会放你出去过圣诞节吗？还有几天就到了。”

source: Kari tapped twice on the lantern. No, as Ivory predicted. The Ice King never let Kari out, as she was seen as “a flaw” in his eyes. She was born mute and was the only girl in her family, as it was all made up of boys.
target: 卡莉敲了两下灯笼。不，正如艾沃里所预料的那样。冰王从不让卡莉出去，因为在他眼里，她是个“瑕疵”。她生来就是哑巴，是家里唯一的女孩，因为家里全是男孩。

source: Ivory was too, in their own special way. When Ivory came out as nonbinary, it seemed like the world changed too. They were given the jobs that would make them spend time alone for most of the time, as a punishment for being different.
target: 艾沃里也是如此，以他们自己独特的方式。当艾沃里公开自己是非二元性别者时，世界似乎也改变了。他们被分配到的工作会让他们大部分时间都独自度过，作为对他们与众不同的惩罚。

source: They were also forced to work as the princess’ servant. They didn’t mind it much thought, as they got a friend too.
target: 他们还被迫成为公主的仆人。但他们并不介意，因为他们也得到了一个朋友。

source: “It’s your birthday soon, isn’t it?” Ivory asked, remembering that the princess’ birthday was in a few days. Kari nodded, a sad glint in her light blue eyes.
target: “很快就是你的生日了，不是吗？”艾沃莉问道，想起公主的生日还有几天。卡莉点点头，淡蓝色的眼睛里闪着悲伤的光芒。

source: “Do you want to celebrate?” They asked, reflecting on the last time she answered it.
target: “你想庆祝一下吗？”他们问道，回想起她上次回答这个问题时的情景。

source: No. Kari tapped out. Ivory knew that it was a hard subject for her. It was the day that she was confined to her room and her mother was banished. Ivory was only a baby when it happened, but they remembered the outrage the servants and townspeople were in. They heard Queen Eirwen was a nice queen, but also weirdly predicted things that would happen.
target: 不。卡莉放弃了。艾沃里知道这对她来说是个很难的话题。那天她被关在房间里，她的母亲被放逐了。当这件事发生时，艾沃里还只是个婴儿，但他们还记得仆人和镇民们的愤怒。他们听说艾尔文女王是一位好女王，但也奇怪地预言了将要发生的事情。

source: “So… whatcha wanna do?” They asked. Kari looked up at them, teeming with excitement. She handed Ivory a paper. When they looked down at it however…
target: “所以……你们想做什么？”他们问道。卡莉抬头看着他们，兴奋不已。她递给艾沃莉一张纸。然而，当他们低头看纸时……

source: 0430 Itania time. Cohren hated waking up this early. Mainly because it was his responsibility to wake everyone else up in his company. Silently stepping out of his bunk, he put on his combat fatigues, throwing on his assault vest, and packed up his belongings from his locker, being careful with a particular small box. He shoulded his rifle and put his helmet on a small hook connected to his belt. It had all its fixing, respirator, goggles, everything needed. After checking his ammo pouches, he quietly walked out of the barracks, mud and ice squelching under his boots.
target: 意大利时间 04:30。科伦讨厌这么早起床。主要是因为他有责任叫醒连队里的其他人。他默默地从铺位上走下来，穿上战斗服，披上突击背心，从储物柜里收拾好自己的物品，小心翼翼地拿着一个特别的小盒子。他扛起步枪，把头盔挂在腰带上的小钩子上。头盔上挂满了所有配件，包括呼吸器、护目镜，所有需要的东西。检查完弹药袋后，他静静地走出营房，泥土和冰块在他的靴子下发出吱吱声。

source: He took a lighter from his jacket pocket and a cig from the other. Lighting it, he took a small drag before opening the door slightly. Over the last week he had to get creative when waking the men and women under his command. He stopped using the preset wake up alarm, half the time it never worked, when all that came from the speakers was a light hiss.
target: 他从夹克口袋里掏出一只打火机，从另一只口袋里掏出一支香烟。点燃后，他轻轻吸了一口，然后稍微打开了门。在过去的一周里，他不得不想办法叫醒手下的男男女女。他不再使用预设的闹钟，因为有一半的时间闹钟都不起作用，而扬声器里发出的只是轻微的嘶嘶声。

source: “Waking them up” Cohren turned to see 2nd Lieutenant Nemic walking up.
target: “叫醒他们”科伦转身看到少尉内米克走了过来。

source: Before he could answer, the door opened and Harris, Craith, and a few others hurried out, already fully dressed and kitted out.
target: 还没等他回答，门就开了，哈里斯、克雷斯和其他几个人匆匆走了出来，他们已经穿戴整齐。

source: “Yes sir. There should be on their way now, we gave them time to grab rations from the mess” 	At 0500 sharp, Exodus company assembled at the motor pool. Shaw stepped onto a box and began to speak.
target: “是的，长官。他们现在应该在路上了，我们给了他们时间去食堂拿口粮。”凌晨 5 点整，Exodus 连队在车队集合。肖踏上一个箱子，开始讲话。

source: “Where are moving out to FOB I-131, fifty miles outside of Ianlos. We are to support the ongoing siege and later attack of Ianlos to flush out the insurgency there. From there we will have a foothold and the base of the mountains” Shaw explained. “Get with your squads and mount up”
target: “我们要前往 I-131 前进作战基地，距离伊安洛斯五十英里。我们要支援对伊安洛斯的持续围攻和随后的进攻，以清除那里的叛乱分子。从那里我们将有一个立足点和山脚，”肖解释道。“带上你的小队，上马吧”

source: The company dispersed, joining together in their squads and their sergeants had them mount up on one of the tanks. Cohren pulled himself onto one of the tanks farther up on the convoy, joining Nemic, Craith, and two new recruits. Cohren remembered them arriving a few days ago, but didn’t know much about them. Sitting on the side, dangling his legs on the side, he adjusted his pack and radio set, which connected to his earpiece and throat mic.
target: 连队解散，汇合到各自的小队，军士们让他们登上其中一辆坦克。科伦爬上车队前方的一辆坦克，与内米克、克雷思和两名新兵会合。科伦记得他们几天前就到了，但对他们了解不多。他坐在一旁，双腿悬空，调整着背包和无线电装置，无线电装置与耳机和喉部麦克风相连。

source: “Hey Cohren, does Harris still have Snowball?” Nemic asks as they got settled in.
target: “嘿，科伦，哈里斯还留着雪球吗？”他们安顿下来后，内米克问道。

source: “You mean his chicken he stole?” Cohren remembered the morning they had stolen him from a farm. “Yeah, i'm pretty sure”
target: “你是说他偷的鸡？”科伦记得他们把他从农场偷走的那天早上。“是的，我很确定”

source: Cohren glanced over to one of the other tanks and spotted Harris with his squad. From the back of his pack he could just make out the movement of a small chicken moving its head around, scanning the surroundings.
target: 科伦朝另一辆坦克望去，发现了哈里斯和他的小队。从背包的背面，他只能看到一只小鸡在晃动着脑袋，扫视着周围的环境。

source: “Yup, he still has him” Cohren answered as the tank's turret hatch clanked open and its commander came into view.
target: “是的，他还在那儿”，科伦回答道，此时坦克的炮塔舱门“咔哒”打开，坦克的指挥官出现在视野中。

source: “All tanks were moving out” The commander started calmly but clearly into his headset. The engines of a platoon of tanks and Strykers roared to life as they started moving forward. The Kronos Cohren was on jolted as its break released and moved forward, getting into formation. The tanks took up a wedge formation as they moved across the Itania plains. The winter storms had frozen over the wetlands and forests, but the mud always remained.
target: “所有坦克都在出动”指挥官平静而清晰地从耳机中开始说道。一排坦克和斯崔克坦克的引擎轰鸣着开始前进。克罗诺斯·科伦号在刹车松开后向前移动，进入队形。坦克在穿过伊塔尼亚平原时形成楔形队形。冬季风暴冻结了湿地和森林，但泥浆始终存在。

source: After around an hour, one of the new recruits, Cohren, remembered his name being Orson, spoke up. “Lieutenant, you’ve been here since the start of the war, right?”
target: 大约一个小时后，一名新兵科伦（他记得自己叫奥森）开口说道：“中尉，战争开始后你就在这里了，对吧？”

source: “Yup, Operation Firestorm,” Cohren answered. “We thought it would be over in a few weeks, but…we underestimate them”
target: “是的，烈焰风暴行动，”科伦回答道。“我们以为几周后就会结束，但是……我们低估了他们。”

source: The advancement of Humanity never ceased, even for a moment–during difficult times we grow and adapt once again. The cities are as prosperous as ever, and our technological advancement is rising.
